reviews.text: View enlarged photos of Hitler's reign of terror, follow the numbered story boards and read the description of each board (in English and German, outside you can walk along a long section of the infamous Berlin wall and also see the remains of the basements where the SS had their headquarters. Highly recommended and it's free admission.

Very cool place with a lot of information that you really cannot find in most places. Very comfortable building with plenty of space to chill out or actually read the exhibit. It took a good amount of time to read through everything but got a little crowded. Would definitely recommend!
Very detailed museum partly in- and outside. No entrance fee. Interactivity is low,  but information provided is detailed and very interesting. Spend easily 2 hours there

After our walking tour of Berlin, this was the perfect way to top off all the historical knowledge shared. There is a lot to absorb, so take your time. Free lockers available. Clean Bathrooms downstairs. Free and very educational.

Extremely informative and educative. It was also very crowded so I had to just skip some of the pictures and rush through some others because if time restrain. But be prepared to spend a great chunk of your day at this place and leave strangely amazed and touch by the things history can tell.

Much longer than I expected. It takes about 20 minutes to walk along the whole thing without stopping. Some very impressive works of art that are changed often, commissioned by artists all around the world. Expect a lot of queues for a picture at the more famous works.

Interesting spot to see the great street Art on the wall and to imagine what it was like with the wall still up.

Nice bars and restaurants in the vicinity. Also the massive Mercedes Benz Arena is close to this place.

I suggest arriving here with U3 to see the surroundings and to get better to the feeling.

I always walk along the entire stretch of the East Side Gallery, every time I'm in Berlin.  The history of this is both important and incredible. I am so happy and impressed that Berlin have chosen to kept this huge section of the original Berlin Wall, rather than try to forget the past. I would recommend this to any tourist.

East side gallery is the remains of the Berlin wall. Lot of beautiful paintings on the wall with messages on contemporary issues which you'll like. A river is flowing by the side of the wall with a thin park in the middle. There are restaurants by the riverside and a boat hostel in the river. Overall, its a good place to spend your afternoon or evening.

Interesting Place. But you have to be careful there is street gamblers. Maybe they are one team. You can just enjoy see the wall and art
also take a picture

As silver member got free upgrade to junior suite. One of the best suites i've been to. On 11 floor with balcony to the sea and great view on the city. Breakfast is also good with big variety. Recommend.
Awesome hotel. Really clean, well laid out rooms. The staff are all friendly, professional and helpful. Breakfast is amazing and the bar serves good food throughout the day. Highly recommend!

Very good location, clean rooms, very good breakfast.. There is a cosy lobby bar with friendly staff.
Fitness room is very small and hot water gets cold sometimes..
Location wise it gets all the 5 stars. Pretty clean. Friendly staff. Decent breakfast and lovely breakfast lounge. Ideally I would want a room with a view of the Caspian.
Stayed here for 1 night new years eve. Room was comfortable and clean. Located walking distance from the mall and restaurants

The view was great. Berlin is a beautiful city also from above and there is a lot of information about the major and most important buildings, written there, to help you understand what you observe.I loved it. At the observation floor, there is also a nice  bar, where you can seat and have a drink.

Didn't buy a fast track ticket so had to queue but that didn't take long (I think we timed the visit well). Got a discount with the Welcome Berlin card. Great views across the city. The bar at the top was really busy and the whole floor smelled of the food from the restaurant (which smelled good!!). Worth a visit

On a sunny day with clear skies, this place is a must for the panoramic views of Berlin from every angle. There is also a bar and restaurant here, though you need to book a reservation. The restaurant seating area is revolving, slow enough you hardly notice. On the viewing deck there is a bar, which also also serves good cocktails. Over the years the entry price to the tower has risen considerably, though still worth going.

Perfect 360 view of Berlin. I went there at night which made the atmosphere special with all the lights, but I wasn't able to see many things in detail. Also the whole staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

A must if your in Berlin. A drink or food at altitude. Would highly recommended.  You can look all over berlin and information boards explain what you can see.  Also it's a good reference point in Berlin when your out and about travelling

Awesome government building that is free to visit. Just get your pass from the office and they will give you a time slot to visit, make sure you have photo id. The dome at the top is remarkable with 360° views of the city. An audio guide is also given which tells you the history of the building and its surroundings as you walk up the dome. Highly recommend visiting this place!

This is the German parliament building with lot of history! They've the old designed building and inside there is modern chambers for the law makers. Interesting part is, tourist can visit the building which is limited to the dome and roof top terrace. You've to make an online appointment which is free and they'll allocate a time slot for you on your chosen date. Take a print out of the reservation confirmation and go along with your photo ID.
Once you’re up, staffs will provide you an audio guide which is intelligent enough to locate you and do the commentary perfectly. You'll have a 360° view of Berlin and audio guide will tell you what you're seeing! This experience is amazing and worthy once you're in Berlin. Thanks to German government for such a nice and free arrangement for tourists that people will remember always!

The tour through this place is excellent. Must visit for all tourists visiting Berlin. Please get your tickets in advance so that you don’t have to wait in the queue for long. The view of the parliament building from inside is breathtaking. If you are lucky and time it perfectly you can also enjoy the live parliament session. Audio guides are available in many languages. There is also a tour of history in pictures around.

Must visit when in Berlin, a building with a lot of history behind it. Really cool to walk by any time of day. The tour is something that you must plan ahead for as there are certain entry times you have to reserve, highly recommend doing it at night as the roof is beautiful during that time.

It's a Part of Parliament Building, Bundestag. Roof top terrace and dome of the building is the famous tourist attraction. It's open for public & tourist with world class security. It's built is very unique and the entire dome walls is made of glass. The view is just amazing.. We are provided with wired headphone  audio guide, which brings life to the visiting experience. It's a must visit place if u r in Berlin.
Highly recommended

Really nice Aquarium and Terrarium zoo, they have a beautiful collection of reptiles (I'm a real reptile lover) in really nice terrariums. The aquarium section was very nice as well, the amazon exhibit in particular is really nice. There is also a section with insects.
Loved it. Fantastic displays... Very well set out. Nice place to sit and relax watching the fish... The colours of the tropical fish took your breath away.. Amazing..

Lovely species I hadn't seen before in other aquariums. Many many jellyfishes, which is awesome! The entrance is quite expensive though and the aquarium is not so big. The tanks seem also quite small but I'm no specialist on the matter. Large exposition of bugs and reptilians also included in the ticket.

A great experience in Berlin! I was thinking of going to the aquarium but I'm so happy I finally did it! Amazing colours and lights give you a feeling like you are directly there under the sea or jungle! Don't miss it!

A must see if you visit Zoo Berlin! It's definitely one of the best parts of the zoo. I loved the plan of the building, the aquariums and terrariums and the amount of species on display. The large aquariums with the Arapaimas were one of the best. There's a wide variety of exhibits and all of them had well-designed signs.

We went to the old Baroque part of the building! The audio guide is very good and easy to use and allows for you to go at your own pace. Cost us €12 I think and if we paid a bit extra we could have seen the new part of the palace which is the part with the beautiful blue room that you see in most of the pictures online. That’s not to say there isn’t things in the old part worth seeing, it truly was a beautiful experience, the rooms in the palace are marvellous. I’ve only added pictures of the front of the palace so you can experience the interior for yourself. 

You do have to pay to take pictures. I think an extra €3 we designated one person in our group to be the photographer and split the cost.

The Palace & gardens are lovely to spend a few hours wondering around. If you go into the palace; request the audio guide which is included in the ticket price as the information is really helpful. I would recommend visiting on a sunny day so you can really appreciate the gardens.
Nice park  English style.  To enjoy it visit in May.  The residence makes a nice background.  All renewed as it was destroyed.  Didn't visit inside

Absolutely must see in Berlin. In awe of the lavish lifestyle lived by the royals centuries ago. Despite not having all the technological advances of our generation, they must have lived an amazing life. Loved the details and the preservation of the palace. The backyard is breath taking. I would compare it to Central Park in Manhattan.
Very beautiful palace with great history. A must see for imperial history lovers. The tour includes an audio guide which is very helpful and informative. It also saves having to read everything.

Among the best botanical gardens in the world. Interesting outdoor spaces but also many indoor collections if you are visiting on a rainy day. Wonderful collection of cacti. Beautiful nature paths. Definitely a worthy part of any visit to Berlin.

This was the best botanical garden that i have visited during early Spring. Its very well priced and the glass houses were brilliant, ferns, cactus, Tropical, so many different rooms and each was throughly enjoyed. 
Take a picnic if the weather if good and even a few beers like i saw some locals. 
The coffee shop also serves lovely cold, big beers) Thumbs up on that and the gift shop has some lovely items.

The outside grounds weren't quite in bloom yet but they were still beautiful. The many and massive greenhouses were amazing. Different regions of the world, different climates and all were meticulously cared for.

Beautiful Botanical garden. They have plants from all continents. It is also interesting in winter time because the glasshouses with plants are huge. So you don't have to be afraid that you wont have anything to see if it's winter.

It is my most visited place in Berlin. I had two times a year ticket and I used it many times. I was there in average 2 times a week. 

The vegan soup is awesome! The houses are the perfect friend in winter months. The gardens are great for the summer. 

For all touristic and local interest's important place! 

You can walk by food from breitenbachplatz
Lovely well maintained palace - great views from every angle

The presidential residence. Nice atmosphere around and lovely place to visit highly recommended as a sightseeing before you going to  visit the victory column, but nothing else to do beside that. Just enjoy the history of this place.
Looks very beautiful
Nice to sit in front of the Palace with someone you love
Beautiful sight, easy to stop by and look at, but one cannot go inside. Tourists can dedicate about 5 minutes, but it's not a must.
Stunning architecture.

Amazing collection.Several sources of information available in multiple languages. Audio guides were very well done. Admission can be combined with other museums for savings and convenience, payment via cash or credit card. Restaurant on site- cash only. Gift shop on site.
Art and design. This place is big and it will last you at least half of a day to go through it. Lucky there's a small nice cafeteria where you can have lunch.

We didn't really understand what this place was about, I think there was an entrance to something like a museum, but we didn't see anything like we expected. However, the buildings has beautiful architectures.
A government Art and Design Gallery. The collection are amazingly exclusive and beautiful.

A true beauty to see in person. Just gorgeous. People in & around the building were greatly respectful. So glad we were able to visit it in 2017! The church in ruins is just as gorgeous as the one built in memorial. The history is so rich, wonderful educational moment for our young daughter. 

Ontario, Canada
Visited April 2017

This is an great church with an awesome history.  We paid the entrance fee, which was well worth it.  The inside of this church is very picturesque and the outside surrounding area is also very nice and photogenic.  I enjoy coming here every time I come to Berlin.  A couple of selfies here are an absolute must for any tourist.

Very impressive architectural design. The true landmark of Berlin. The first monumental building that struck my attention when I started the sightseeing in 2017. The roof paintings are remarkable. The Protestant church nearby has a lot to tell about the church.

Touching scene where you can see what is the real demolution. Nice try the new church. It is very nice from the outside but nothing special from inside, but it is an active church so it has to be like this.
Beautiful and quiet place. The blue stained glass gives a wonderful atmosphere.
Beautiful museum with a lot of information about Kollwitz and a lot of (famous) artwork. We've only paid €4 (student discount), otherwise it's €7 but absolutely worth it.
Harrowing but very profound artist well worth a visit
Small museum, interesting and well presented.Very emotional story of an amazing woman and are work
A very nice museum if you're interested in Kollwitz's life and work. It's a bit sparse for the 7 euro admission though.
Very intimate museum, a real experience and a discovery, just go !

Good, very clean hotel in a decent neighborhood. Over a dozen restaurants within easy walking distance. About a 20 minute drive to the airport. Comfortable bar, and great breakfast spread! Limited parking on site, but there is a public garage less than a block away that is only 10 euro for 24 hours. Train line passes directly by the hotel, but rooms have excellent sound isolation.

A really well presented hotel in the Western part of Berlin. The room was a good size, decent modern bathroom and the hotel was quiet. Breakfast was included which is always a bonus. The food was very good and there was a decent selection of hot and cold food. Would definitely stay here again.
My reliable go to. Great bar. Hampton US - this is how it should be!

Just back from a work trip which involved me staying one night here. Great location just a short walk from shops and station the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. Even though room was facing the train tracks once window was closed there was no noise at all. Breakfast was nice enough and the area clean and well kept. If I return to Berlin will definitely stay here again.

The BEST hotel you can find - friendly service, very good breakfast. The hotel is very clean, and in great location near shopping street and public transportation.
Great value for money!

We went to the old Baroque part of the building! The audio guide is very good and easy to use and allows for you to go at your own pace. Cost us €12 I think and if we paid a bit extra we could have seen the new part of the palace which is the part with the beautiful blue room that you see in most of the pictures online. That’s not to say there isn’t things in the old part worth seeing, it truly was a beautiful experience, the rooms in the palace are marvellous. I’ve only added pictures of the front of the palace so you can experience the interior for yourself. 

You do have to pay to take pictures. I think an extra €3 we designated one person in our group to be the photographer and split the cost.

The Palace & gardens are lovely to spend a few hours wondering around. If you go into the palace; request the audio guide which is included in the ticket price as the information is really helpful. I would recommend visiting on a sunny day so you can really appreciate the gardens.
Nice park  English style.  To enjoy it visit in May.  The residence makes a nice background.  All renewed as it was destroyed.  Didn't visit inside

Absolutely must see in Berlin. In awe of the lavish lifestyle lived by the royals centuries ago. Despite not having all the technological advances of our generation, they must have lived an amazing life. Loved the details and the preservation of the palace. The backyard is breath taking. I would compare it to Central Park in Manhattan.
Very beautiful palace with great history. A must see for imperial history lovers. The tour includes an audio guide which is very helpful and informative. It also saves having to read everything.

Impressive place with some of the nicest Art Nouveau and Art Deco artifacts. The temporary exhibitions are worth seeing, too. The George Grosz exhibition I have visited was astonishing. Do not forget to visit the museum shop, too.

I came to see art nouveau pieces, but there did not seem to be any around. Most rooms were empty, temporary exhibits were on, but for me they were not worth the visit at all. Shop closed. Staff angry and no explanation for where things were. If they were changing exhibits, I wish they would warn visitors.
Needs a renovation. Good exhibitions.
The current show of arts and crafts to Bauhaus is great!
Fabulous Art Deco art, furniture, and other exemplary objects in beautiful displays.  On recent travel, we bought most of our gifts for family members back home in this gift shop. Highly recommended.
This is a good place , like it.
Great experience
Informative memorial, describing another piece of Germany dark and evil past. Entrance is free. Definitely worth a visit.
Minimalistic and informative. Free entrance. It really moved me. I left with tears in my eyes.
History.

A must see if you’re in Berlin. Very interesting and great photo ops! We missed out on the guided tour which gets you behind the scenes to the players locker rooms - but the regular self guided tour was still very good and super affordable. Delighted we decided to go!

Went last year during European Athletics Championship. Absolutely amazing experience! We thoroughly enjoyed both visiting the site and watching the game. Huge and magnificent, very well maintained! I would recommend the place to anyone who is coming to Berlin. It is a must see!
Beautiful historic stadium. Got goosebumps being at a place that beforehand we only get to see through history books & documentaries. Nice classical design as well.

Worth doing if you're in Berlin looking for touristy things to do. Tour goes all round the stadium and there's a few flights of stairs and a lot of walking. 

Our tour guide was great and clearly very knowledgeable about the stadium (as you'd expect).

Price for a tour is fair and the gift shop isn't too overpriced either.

Only downside was that the pitch was covered in plastic panels due to Ed Sheeran performing there that night.

In the outskirts of Berlin but can easily be reached. A must visit place if you haven't seen an Olympic Stadium as this is huge and the statues, bell and front offer nice views. There is a lavatory in Block T and a restaurant as well close by. Souvenir shop at the entrance. Group tours are also available. Read history of it and what happened in those Olympic games, you will be more enthused to visit.
Nice and small museum with some cool sculptures inside and outside in the garden.
Very tranquil tiny museum with lovely sculpture

Very nice modernist building and always very well curated sculpture shows. The cafe K next door is underrated and very special. Both together are worth  a day trip and the sculpture park nearby completes the visit.

A serene place with its own spirit. The collection of Kolbe's sculptures are, although limited, quite fascinating. They have a liveliness to them that truly entices. The garden is half of the exhibition, with several sculptures and its contemplating atmosphere.
The cafe is great.

It was closed when I was there... But is an amazing place, even at night. I do not t
Recoment it because you are going to see it only from the outside, but it's still amazing.
Interesting, old building, with a fantastic view, below you get coffee, cake and more

The bike ride to the tower itself is an experience on its own. Such an amazing track and the destination is even better. The great panoramic view of Berlin after the intense ride feels very rewarding. And to finish off the day with a nice coffee from the restaurant, makes the trip complete.

Such a colorful autumn we name in Poland Gold Polish Autumn,. so I was feeling like in home when I entered Grunewald. Pained with hold and red, and green big forest around a like, additionally grew on several hills - imagine the beauty of the view I found. And the smell of a forest... You can easy forget that you are in Berlin, quite a big city. So, if it out need as some rest it is a perfect place, especially in October. There is a limit for driving car of 30 km/h in all area.
Love it. Is very peaceful.
Interesting, good, friendly, highly recommended for those who is interested in astronomy. Unfortunately in german language.
Pink Floyd OK

Gehört für mich seit Jahrzehnten zu Berlin, als Kind oft mit der Klasse dagewesen. Heute seltener, was schade ist. Es gibt wirklich tolle Veranstaltungen und es ist jedesmal ein Erlebnis. Hier wird Einem das Universum näher gebracht.

He visitado este lugar varías veces . Siempre me sorprende lo amable que son los empleados y la atención que le brindan a los visitantes . El programa es variado , es una excelente opción para visitar con o sin niños

Tolles Planetarium.
Mit sehr abwechslungsreichem Programm für groß und klein. Für jeden was dabei. Freundliche Mitarbeiter. Anreise mit den Öffentlichen gut und mit Auto ein Parkplatz vor Ort. 
Preise auch Top. Im Eintritt inklusive ist der Besuch für die Sternwarte nebenan. Entweder am gleichen Tag oder mit Ticket innerhalb der nächsten 6 Wochen
A nice little cafe. Very good cakes and decent coffee.
Lovely place with nice sweets, unique tea choices.
Ok, for quick beer.  Good service.
Super  super, super netter Service!!!!👍🏽

Wine selection is very good. Otherwise it's awful, because especially mid-week there is only one staff totally overchallenged. I've been there many times and with this review the last time. Be prepared to wait 20+ minutes for your order or remind the waiter what you've ordered.

I didn't expect too much from this small "Kiezkneipe" when I visited it the first time. But it has become our place to go when we want to have a drink after work or so. You can smoke inside, order food from the nearby Eckstein and have a good time. 
The staff is super friendly and has taken us in very nicely. It's nothing that you would expect in Berlin nowadays. Nothing hipstery, no fancy decor, no elaborate drinks on the menu, no wild stories attached to its name. 
It's nothing fancy, but it is home. And sometimes that's all you need after a stressed day at work

Friendly pub with large-screen tv (public match viewing) even for smokers.
We went there around noon on a weekday with some friends to have something to drink. Cool place, good music, friendly staff. I recommend it as a pub.

They had one person working on a Saturday morning with ton of customer and I ordered pancakes and they have no pancake syrup the coffee creamer was old and clump up in my coffee just plain nasty and to think I specifically went there because of the reviews
They serve a good menu of breakfast here.  Nice location. Prices are ok. Good place for brunch.

Just happened to come across this bar. Music from background is cool. Lots of foos, pumpkins and heard some greenday. Very relaxing place. Big TV to watch sports. Cosy place to have a beer. Staff very very friendly. Recommended as a pub.

Good, very clean hotel in a decent neighborhood. Over a dozen restaurants within easy walking distance. About a 20 minute drive to the airport. Comfortable bar, and great breakfast spread! Limited parking on site, but there is a public garage less than a block away that is only 10 euro for 24 hours. Train line passes directly by the hotel, but rooms have excellent sound isolation.

A really well presented hotel in the Western part of Berlin. The room was a good size, decent modern bathroom and the hotel was quiet. Breakfast was included which is always a bonus. The food was very good and there was a decent selection of hot and cold food. Would definitely stay here again.
My reliable go to. Great bar. Hampton US - this is how it should be!

Just back from a work trip which involved me staying one night here. Great location just a short walk from shops and station the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. Even though room was facing the train tracks once window was closed there was no noise at all. Breakfast was nice enough and the area clean and well kept. If I return to Berlin will definitely stay here again.

The BEST hotel you can find - friendly service, very good breakfast. The hotel is very clean, and in great location near shopping street and public transportation.
Great value for money!
Nice food but nothing special. Fair prices.

If you miss Russian cuisine.
Not the most delicious, but also not pricey.
The staff is friendly 👍
Amzing authentic russian borscht. Must try.
Very nice Russian food. Good service and atmosphere. It's not expensive as well.
Great buffet from Monday till Friday
German beer tasted good. It made a  delicious combination with pig knuckle, sauerkraut, potatoes. Green salad serve nice and cold. All for good price.
A lovely German experience. Beer and food were amazing and the price was just about right. Will def go there again and 100% recommend it!
Authentic classic german experience. A lot of beer with affordable prices. A lot of people and giant portions of food. Especially good place during warm time, because of the chill atmosphere around.

Amazing food, best Kaiserschmarren ever and a place where you will find a great diversity of people. Locals, tourists, young people, families and seniors. One of my most favorite culture and food places in Berlin!
Kept us waiting for 40 minutes before taking our order when restaurant was practically empty. Only one waiter. Would not recommend.

Great food place with a reasonable choice of Italian food. You order what you want and they load a card with the item, so could go up and get multiple things. Pay as the end with the charge card. Interesting concept! Near the statue of the souls

To be honest, I didn't think too positively about the concept of the self service restaurant. And, yeah, the waiting time - standing in the queue - seems quite long. But it is rather entertaining to see your food being prepared directly in front of you.
But the most important point for the 5-star-ratibg is that you can order gluten-free dishes. I went there with a friend of mine who can't eat gluten and she loved the fact that she was able to eat at a restaurant. And the prices are fair, too.
Tasty food but I'm still not familiar with this strange order system
Gluten free pizza and pasta galore! Definitely run like a chain so not the healthiest and freshest and most varied options (salad, etc) but my kid loves it. Real nice vibe!
Really tasty food. Good chain. Nothing unexpected.
Great food, service and price. Cleanliness of toilets beyond reproach.
Excellent mussels and house wine...try the wine sauce with coriander for the mussels!
Great people nice atmosphere excellent food
Great Portuguese food. Excellent customer service

I've been here several times and always get the same dish: Portuguese Ribs. If you go on Sunday, the price is two for one! The garlic and rosemary potatoes are very tasty too. The green been are cooked just right and are not mushy. The salad is a good way to start this exceptional meal. The house Vino Verdi is excellent and a good price too! Sit outside and watch the people go by on the KuDamm. Inside is cozy.

Very good place. I enjoyed the service and the food. The rib eye is perfect and the fillet minion is divine. Come hungry, the portions are big!! Have a nice evening with family/friends/partners. Have fun, stay cool!

This is obviously a popular place. There was a queue to get in and we were told there was a 45 min wait for main course. Which is reasonable if you're having a starter, but we weren't. The food was tasty but just slapped on the plate. No presentation. The service was poor due to lack of servers but our waiter was lovely and they need to either restrict the number of covers they try to sell or increase their kitchen. We paid €52 for tbone and 2 medallions plus two drinks.
The steaks are good enough for the price (which is above average I guess). The staff is nice and the service is rather quick. Beer choice could be a bit better.

אחת מהמסעדות הטובות שנתקלתי בברלין!
שירות מצוין והאוכל מעולה!
הכל טרי ומשובח!
גם בפעם השלישית היה כייף לחזור.
מומלץ לשלב את תערובת הפלפל על הבשר
(אפשר לרכוש אותה)

One of the best restaurants I've ever encountered in Berlin!
Excellent service and excellent food!
Everything is fresh and great!
For the third time it was fun to come back.
It is recommended to combine the pepper mixture on the meat
(Can be purchased)

This was a classic "steak & potatoes" kind of place. I had a burger (beef patty) and it was excellent. Could tell that it was a chain restaurant, but the food was delicious and the staff were very friendly. The layout and the food felt very "American" to me.

Absolutely outstanding. The service, the food, the atmosphere. I think it's quite possibly one of the nicest restaurants I've ever been in.

We ordered the grilled calamari, and then each had a steak which was beautiful done. The desserts "hasselnuss parfait" was DIVINE.

A truly perfect dining experience.
Wonderful experience,  staff were so friendly with good English. Varied menu to suit all tastes. Lovely atmosphere. Calm and romantic.  Pets are welcome.

I'm picky and I'm Italian. Being at Bellucci's was an amazing culinary experience I recommend to everyone. Impeccable service and quality food in a cozy atmosphere. The higher price you pay is definitely worth it. Nothing compared to those cheap fake Italian restaurants Berlin has plenty of.
Good value for money. I enjoyed the saltimbocca and service was very friendly and attentive. The place was packed, so reservations are recommended.
This place is really good. Waiters are friendly and live their italian way of treat you. Food was amazing!

Was one of the worst meals I've had in a very long time. I had a good meal there, which is why I went back. Something has changed as this was simply terrible. Tasted like water with some old curry powder. Wasn't just my meal either, the other dishes were equally bad. Complete no go.
The food here is so tasteless that I wouldn’t know what I was eating even while I was eating it! On top of it half an hour after my guts are completely messed up. No go.
Good food and a relaxed atmosphere

Went home with half a food poisoning.
Took the 4 course menu. Started well but ended bad. Food was tasteless and watery. I'm sorry, but never again.
The food was very very good, nice service. The only negative thing was that the same song played again and again, but it didn't bother me that much. Also nice atmosphere and dekoration.

One of my favorite Thai restaurants in Berlin. Food is awesome at good prices. Great choice, mostly crowded (because so good), so you should better make a reservation, especially at the evening / weekend
If one loves Thai food, this is the place to go. I recommend the papaya salad

I have such a wonderful experience at the restaurant. The food is really authentic and definitely "zab". If you are craving for Thai food, this is the place to come. I recommend slow-cooked pork noodle and Som Tum, papaya salad.
Spicy Thai food for very good price. Very tasty Tom Kha Gai. This place is bigger than the other Papaya and seem to serve more options. Great deal for a lunch in this area.

I really enjoy my food here. I ordered Pad Thay with garnelen and Ice Tea. It was really good decision! The food was soooo good!
The Rindfleischsuppe is also delicious! 
They accept card ;)
Very delicious and good Iranian food. The service was friendly and quick. I can only recommend.
Fantastic restaurant, the staff made me feel very comfortable and cosy. The food was amazing and the background music was ear candy. I will definitely come back.
Amazing and flavorful! Good value too. Server was friendly. Just google translate there online menu. I got the grilled plate for two with rice, which was massive and had a nice variety.

No menu in English. 
Waiter forgot about the order. Partially completed it once reminder and after 1 hour of waiting. 
Place is very small.
Food is quite tasty.
The food is awesome and prices are reasonable! I had Baghalipolo ba Mahiche and it was soooo delicious! The restaurant is tiny but really cosy and staff are very friendly ! Highly recommended !
Wiesenstein has been redecorated and has a new menu. The Knusperschäufele (pork shoulder boiled then grilled) I had was great.
nice restaurant , excellent service and fair prices .
Decent food. Slow service. Nice setting.

This probably the worst restaurant I was in Berlin in 12 years. How can it survive in such a nice location.
The service is so slow and grumpy. Waiters never smile and look like they doing you a favour. If you want to wait for a glass of vine 50min and for food 1 hr 30 min...
The food is avarage.
Also they pretend that all tables reserved but it’s a trick. 
Never again!
Delicious food. Varied menu card. Great beers. Friendly staff. Deserts.. sorry didn't make it. The main dish was huge. Go there.
Easily the best Greek restaurant in Berlin. The meat is grilled to perfection and the menu is full of goodies. The wine selection is quite broad and the service is impeccable. Highly recommended.

Family-type restaurant. Very friendly staff who served our group of 15 very well and fast, they helped with the cake we brought with us, as we were celebrating the birthday of one of us. The meals were delicious. I would gladly recommend it.
Food was really nice. I tried the lamb in the picture and it was quite good. Service was also nice.
I love this place. It was recommended by a Greek colleague, and I always go there with groups of family that want a relaxed environment and don't mind it being loud.
One of the best food experiences of my life. I've had a lot of good food but this really comes in the top ten without a question. What an experience. Thank you!

A very nice and classical Berliner restaurant with tables on the street in the summertime. One of my favorite places when I crave descent food,  professional waiters and an excellent wine-card. Here you have a little break from the Berliner rudeness and student-services. Everything is here well. From breakfast to lunch, to tees and dinner, even for a late night drink - this place runs perfectly oiled like the Orient Express. I very much like that. Go there. Enjoy.
Nice food at affordable price. What makes the difference is the excellent service. Recommended!
Great place to sit and have a morning breakfast or coffee. Comfortable atmosphere and curtious wait staff.

Love this place. Sushi is outstanding. Very busy 
Book in advance... minimum a week. Delicious food a bit expensive but food is so fresh due to huge turn around of customers. You can pay by card or cash . Recommend the rolls... Any type. Yum
Good sashimi, really great flavourful fish. Service is kinda distant but in a good, calm way. Definitely recommend. Lunch menu is excellent choice and up until 5pm.
Out of 4 dishes only 1 held a decent quality. Closer to 1 star than 3, we did not Even finish our dish. Friendly Staff, ok facility, poor food quality
Maybe the best choice of sushi in Berlin! Tasty food brought to you fast. Recommended!
Cosy place conveniently located in the center, new and elegant, nice decoration and wide variety of German wines. I particularly liked the sparkly rose wine, give it a try!
A proper Japanese style restaurants with a selected menu. Food is cooked on the table, right in front of you. Servers were extremely nice. The food was cooked perfectly.
Really good place, went here for lunch. Serious service with great food, value for money! Threes people stuffed and happy for 70 EUR

Very nice Tippanyaki restaurant with professionalism and a feeling of being in Japan. Well almost. Great service and fun to watch your dinner being prepared. Takes at least two hours if you opt for the menu suggestions. 
The air circulation was a bit lousy the night I was there (not enough to go in the fans over the hot steel frying table).
Kind staff,  freshly prepared food on your table, delicious soup...full Japanese deliacies...

It's ok, not amazingly great to justify the price though. After the novelty wears off, the cooking in front of you becomes a choking hazard. The food is good, but not as good as the ones in Japan and too salty for my taste. So I think it's over-priced and probably something you do once then never go back.

Good, very clean hotel in a decent neighborhood. Over a dozen restaurants within easy walking distance. About a 20 minute drive to the airport. Comfortable bar, and great breakfast spread! Limited parking on site, but there is a public garage less than a block away that is only 10 euro for 24 hours. Train line passes directly by the hotel, but rooms have excellent sound isolation.

A really well presented hotel in the Western part of Berlin. The room was a good size, decent modern bathroom and the hotel was quiet. Breakfast was included which is always a bonus. The food was very good and there was a decent selection of hot and cold food. Would definitely stay here again.
My reliable go to. Great bar. Hampton US - this is how it should be!

Just back from a work trip which involved me staying one night here. Great location just a short walk from shops and station the front desk staff were very helpful and courteous. Even though room was facing the train tracks once window was closed there was no noise at all. Breakfast was nice enough and the area clean and well kept. If I return to Berlin will definitely stay here again.

The BEST hotel you can find - friendly service, very good breakfast. The hotel is very clean, and in great location near shopping street and public transportation.
Great value for money!
Best upscale champagne breakfast. Great eggs benedict and waffles. We enjoyed it!
One of the great ones. Not only the looks are on point but also the staff is friendly, food is delicious. Definitely a place I'd come back to!
Our experience here was terrific. Wonderful view. Had a guest with us & they put up a very comfortable bed for her. Comfort all around. I recommend.
Good location, spacious rooms, tiny gym, modest pool. Service not so top notch considering our three still unsolved requests for a second bathrobe.

My review as posted on trip advisor:  
10!

Review of Waldorf Astoria Berlin
Reviewed December 4, 2016 

With a combined total of over 100 hundred trips to Europe, my husband and I have stayed in many five star hotels. However, the Berlin Waldorf Astoria is unparalleled in luxury, service, efficiency and comfort. From concierge, Mike, to server, Alexander, our every need was met prompt and courteous resolve. The rooms are beyond luxurious with amenities never imagined. The Waldorf Astoria enhanced our wonderful stay in a fascinating city. Thank you!

We are hoping to visit again this year.

A good museum if you like history and learning about spying. Very interesting. 8 euros or 6 euros if you have a Berlin Welcome Card. The dated buildings and surrounding areas provide a great setting for this museum.

Great visit at the Stasi security headquarter. Rooms remained mostly as they were at that time. Is possible to read explanations in English in order to have a better idea about how they conducted the investigations. Watching this place in first person has been very touching.

Great museum about the history of East Germany. It was fascinating to learn about the lives and the political careers of Stasi officiers. The audio guide is very helpful and the museum is typically not very busy.
Really interesting if not quite hard going. Has a very atmosphere. Worth a visit

Amazing environment and really interesting displays. Even better without coach parties, you can get the full atmosphere. To top it off, an authentic Cafe with coffee and evaporated milk at 1980s prices!
Great museum!!!!!!
You must visit if you like history or watched D-land 83, you’ll recognise the rooms.
Hidden history not very well publicised.  Such a historic building and its place in world history. Well worth a visit. Bus service right to front door. A must see

We came here just to take a quick look because it seemed like such a historic piece of the WW2 puzzle. I wasn’t thrilled that it was over a 20 euro taxi for what I thought would be a quick stop (we’re staying near Brandenburg gate). It was SO worth the trip...my mind is so blown. The site is well preserved and the exhibits upstairs are fascinating...really capturing the tragedy and story of the entire war...all the way to and after the surrender. It’s amazing to see the actual surrender documents and video of the event...as you’re sitting in THAT same room. Not nearly as touristy as the other attractions. If you’re even remotely interested in history this is such a treat. Make plans for transport as it is isolated.
Very little nice & free museum

Everyone should visit this museum at least once in a lifetime. We should remember the sacrifices made during World War 2. It's critical to remember tens of millions of lives , soldiers,  nen, women, and children especially nowadays.
Fascinating. You really feel as though you are walking in the footsteps of history. Free entry. And the exhibition upstairs is very good... although it rather glosses over Soviet crimes.
Wonderful and living Trans teamed museum. Great park outside.

Wunderschöne Location für eine Trauung, wir haben im Oktober 2018 geheiratet. Nehmt auf jeden Fall die Musik der Spieluhr als Begleitung. Einzigartig, romantisch. Brautauto kann in der Einfahrt parken, Organisation super. Nur die Zeit zwischen 2 Trauungen sollte länger sein, wirkt etwas wie Massenabfertigung. Trotzdem sehr sehr empfehlenswert.

Sehr Interessant und viel größer als gedacht. Nette und kompetente Führung. Parkplatz gegenüber. Ist auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert. Schon wegen der Möbel und der mechanischen Musikgeräte. Hochzeit kann man dort auch machen.
Fantastisch. Hier haben wir auch aufgrund der tollen Gründerzeitgeschichte geheiratet. Tolle Atmosphäre und nette Führungen...! Absolut lohnenswert.
Muss man gesehen haben. Sehr gute Führung. Ich habe gefühlt meiner Oma, als die eine  junge Frau war, in ihrem Alltag zuzusehen.

The Zentralfriedhof Friedrichsfelde (Friedrichsfelde Cemetery) became known as the Memorial to the Socialists after the Soviet takeover of East Berlin. Located in the eastern district of Lichtenber, it was situated just beyond Karl-Marx-Allee, the one-time showcase street of East Germany, only a few blocks from the former headquarters of the East German state security police, the Stasi.

When the co-founder of the Social Democratic Party (SPD), Wilhelm Liebknecht, was laid to rest here in 1900 in a show of working class solidarity, the funeral procession numbered more than 100,000 people and stretched through the heart of Berlin. Liebknecht was a close personal friend of Karl Marx and had overseen the growth of the SPD from an outlawed group of revolutionary firebrands to the largest political party in Germany.

Liebknecht’s son, Karl, co-founder of the German Communist Party, was interred here in 1919, following his death at the hands of right wing paramilitaries. His burial at Friedrichsfelde marked the beginning of a socialist-communist right of passage.

In 1926, architect Ludwig Mies van der Rohe unveiled a “Monument to the Revolution” at the cemetery, dedicated to the communists who had died in the revolutionary fighting that followed the end of World War I. The Nazis demolished it in 1935, and the present monument to socialists, came up in 1951.

The central obelisk of the current memorial, bearing the words “Die Toten mahnen uns”(The dead remind us), is surrounded by a semi-circular wall containing gravestones bearing the names of old communists and East German Politburo members. The names of 327 men and women who died fighting fascism are etched on tablets.

Ten graves directly surround the central obelisk and bear the most prominent names, including Karl Liebknecht and Rosa Luxemburg, founders of the Communist Party, and Walter Ulbricht, the leader of East Germany.

In the expanse of the cemetery beyond the main socialist memorial, you will find the graves of other notable left-wing figures, including the artist and sculptor Käthe Kollwitz. East German film director Konrad Wolf is here along with his brother Markus, the head of East Germany’s foreign intelligence service.

Der Friedhof ist auf jeden Fall einen Besuch wert.
Viele schöne Denkmäler findet man hier.
Der Friedhof macht im Großen und Ganzen einen Guten und recht gepflegten Eindruck.
Also ich kann jedem empfehlen sich den Friedhof mal anzuschauen.
Sehr schöner und ruhiger Friedhof. Weitläufig und immer wieder neues zu entdecken.
Tolle saubere Anlage, auch mal nett zum langschlendern und entspannen. Ruhige Lage.
Luogo ameno, come tutti i cimiteri, famoso per le sepolture dei socialisti (che sono figlio di Dio anche loro)

Much longer than I expected. It takes about 20 minutes to walk along the whole thing without stopping. Some very impressive works of art that are changed often, commissioned by artists all around the world. Expect a lot of queues for a picture at the more famous works.

Interesting spot to see the great street Art on the wall and to imagine what it was like with the wall still up.

Nice bars and restaurants in the vicinity. Also the massive Mercedes Benz Arena is close to this place.

I suggest arriving here with U3 to see the surroundings and to get better to the feeling.

I always walk along the entire stretch of the East Side Gallery, every time I'm in Berlin.  The history of this is both important and incredible. I am so happy and impressed that Berlin have chosen to kept this huge section of the original Berlin Wall, rather than try to forget the past. I would recommend this to any tourist.

East side gallery is the remains of the Berlin wall. Lot of beautiful paintings on the wall with messages on contemporary issues which you'll like. A river is flowing by the side of the wall with a thin park in the middle. There are restaurants by the riverside and a boat hostel in the river. Overall, its a good place to spend your afternoon or evening.

Interesting Place. But you have to be careful there is street gamblers. Maybe they are one team. You can just enjoy see the wall and art
also take a picture

I really like the taste and quality of the dönner Kebab  Here. The staff are also welcoming and friendly. The price is also relatively lower than other places at least in Lichtenberg district. Another good thing about it is that they are open 20/7 😊😊. I know it should be 24/7 but well they also need some rest so give them 4 hours to rest people. So joking aside I think they are everything that someone expect from a bistro. Did I tell you that their portion are bigger than other places? Well I just said it. Go and enjoy your dönner.
Decent Doner kebabs. You can ask for extra meat as well. They also serve grilled chicken.

Perfectly decent kebab, very moist and flavoursome. However the whole experience was somewhat ruined by the staff who basically threw the kebab at me without a word, it just seemed quite rude. Kebab shops should be fun friendly places and this one just failed to be that.
Nice

Tagsüber sehr zu empfehlen!
Wenn man vor Ort ist sind die Portionen größer. 
Nachts werden die Portionen leider kleiner und ab 0:00 ist meistens auch kein Fleisch mehr da.

This is one of my favorite places in the neighborhood. The guys behind the counter provide quick service, outdoor seating right by a small park, good prices, really good basic food. Just a heads up, if you are looking for mango sauce which some of the imbiss shops have, this place doesn't have it.
Good food, amazing baklava, polite and friendly stuff
Tasty and cheap Sudanese fast food at a great price. Renowned for its peanut sauce, falafel and halloumi.
The best. Super cheap and the most delicious. Peanut sauce makes everything better.
Nice food....good staffs

Great park if you are hipster or drug dealer)
Here’s a lot of weird persons who are walking around. But if you like to smoke something unusual you can find and buy it here.
One strange thing is that drugs are really prohibited in Germany, I’ve heard it from policemen who catches couple of guys, but why it’s so widely spread here?...
I would not recommend it for visiting with the children 👶 
In Berlin a lot of great parks which are really better than this park.

The park is actually good with a lot of playing grounds for children. HOWEVER, even my 13 y.o. boy told me during our morning cycling to Görlitzer Park that the presence of a group of people there makes the atmosphere uncomfortable. These people looks intimidating, they wear outfits that reminds me of gangsters, they're yelling to each other in their language, and stare at my family in a way that made me feel uncomfortable. Regular police patrol would perhaps increase the feeling of security in this park.

Nice park in and of itself with great location, but be ready to have people offering you drugs every couple hundred meters if you look like a potential consumer (that is, anyone between 14 and 30). Many weirdos hanging around but that's probably part of the vibe, and the atmosphere is fairly nice on warm summer days

Love it, it's my local park. Don't be put off by the stories of pushy drug dealers, lots of families also hang out here and wouldn't if it wasn't safe. Just smile and say no thank you and they will get the message, or, if you want, stop and have a chat, most of the guys are interesting people with some great stories to tell and speak a wealth of languages, usually quite fluently.
Grilling is allowed and there are dedicated spots for football as well as a children's play area with slides and swings. In summer you'll get stalls and random guys also selling beers and other cold drinks so you don't even have to interrupt your sun bathing to get your electrolytes replenished.

Great place to get bad drugs and pretty okay weed. Be sure to take the entrance next to the currywurst store, this is where you’ll get most haha 😂 never pay more than 20€ for 2 grams of weed otherwise just walk away, and never go further in to the park than 50-60 meters, that gets creepy...
Very nice and green state park. Has many places to sit and enjoy the sun / grass.

This was a long trek from our hotel, but it was totally worth it for a free 360 view of the city and beautiful landscape. Unfortunately many of the statues and monuments have graffiti all over them. We also couldn’t locate a public restroom. Still a great destination for visitors.
Nice place. I visited it about 4 times so far, enjoyed it every time. It has a beer garden around the back, a nice walk through and of course the view.... amazing.
One of the nicest parks in berlin. Big play ground for people with kids. Close to the great Bergmannstrasse where the great flew market over weekends
Great place to watch the fireworks on new year. The smoke from the fireworks clouds the sky quite fast though and would suggest bringing a scarf to help with keeping from breathing in the air.

The museum exhibit is small but informative. Upper exhbit was closed today. It gives but a small, shallow glimpse of the Holocaust and Jewish identity. Israeli politics are kept family-friendly.

The souvenir shop is varied but prices are a bit too high for trinkets and postcards. Books are good, though.

Highly highly recommend this place. To anyone interested in history. There are a few surprise elements that you don’t expect when you go. It’s something to just experience for yourself. The architecture is of an extremely high standard. Please go!! Also get the audio guides.

I have been to this museum twice now and each time it has been insightful and moving. The permanent exhibition is harrowing, housed in breathtaking architecture, and the current exhibition Welcome to Jerusalem presented an interesting history of the famous city. The food in the cafe is also excellent.

You have to really understand the workings of the architect's mind to get a lot out of this museum. It's all about creating unusual spaces, with few exhibits. The buildings look large from outside but are small on the inside. Would probably be better with a guided tour, and when the upper floors of the old building weren't closed. I found the room with 10000 steel faces made the greatest impression. The gardens are great.

Good general Jewish culture museum.  Some striking and well designed architectural parts and cultural lessons and experiences.  Recommended,  especially if you've never been to a Jewish or holocaust museum, camp or seen a movie.  Yet this is a much broader cultural museum and benefits nicely from that.

interesting exhibitions and all, rooms can be a bit too small and crowded at times but otherwise a super nice museum, definitely go visit if you are in Berlin! you can even buy your tickets in advance on their website to avoid waiting in a long queue :)

I have been here a couple of times over the years and have been impressed by their large and well laid out exhibitions spaces. My only reservation is that the tickets don't allow you to go to all of the exhibitions -- just the one you purchased.  I saw the fascinating Gurlitt show.
Interesting building, very spatious inside. I visited it during the European Film Market and it was impressive the amount of stands it hosted.

Very nice architecture and the building alone is worth visiting. Depending on the exhibition, it's hard to give a rating. Sometimes you get to see quite a lot, sometimes it's just one or two rooms. And depends on taste of course.

The exhibitions were fine but the staff were so rude and made purchasing a student ticket like rocket science. Also you are not allowed to use flash to take a photo, but normal photos are ok, so this staff member kept following us and yelling angry to not use flash...although we never did ?!
A lovely fairy tale themed fountain, worth a visit if you're in the area and part of the volkspark which is great for a visit in nice weather.
A nice place to sit on a sunny day. Good walking trail.
I love it here and the whole park, so just pick a sunny Sunday afternoon and take your time.
Just a nice place to walk around , specially if you have a doggy
Very pretty and calm section of Volkspark Friedrichshain

A modest street frontage conceals a modest courtyard and entrance, which leads to a surprisingly large and warm place of worship.  A beautifully decorated sanctuary and ark also provided wonderful acoustics for the wonderful talents of the resident cantor.
Magnific place, friendly ambience.

Amazing synagogue!
The biggest in Germany and one of the oldest
Wonderful Toddler Shabbat monthly program

I don't know what was the actual reason for my rejection in entering the synagogue. But it was uncomfortable and sad, because I really wanted to see the place and find out if there are people from our country. 
Also i may suppose the veil on my had was triggering for the guard  or I looked too exhausted and cold because of the wind. 
 Or for whatever reason I couldn't come inside , while other people was going in
This church has a wild history. And it nice inside. A beacon of freedom in the late 1980s and one of the many places that helped to end the old system in former East-Berlin.
Friendly local congregation. Imposing and yet pretty for a red brick church. This church is steeped in German political history
Beautiful church! Wheelchair accessible! Very cold in winter - bring good clothing ;)
Gethsemanechurch + choir music = heaven.
A beautiful church that also needs you to walk inside to admire the decoration
Run track is nice and the basketball courts. Also a nice grassy spot for yoga and picnics
Because there are great concerts being held at the Max Schmeling Halle which is here as well
The new outdoor basketball courts are awesome, the only downside is that you can’t really know when they are open.
Great track wish it had more consistent hours, often closed for events.

The complex was just newly renovated and now has a completely new running track as well as a outdoor gym sponsored by adidas. 

It is a great place to work out.
Sehr professionelles Unternehmen! 5sterne!

Yum, yum is the word for Maroush restaurant in Berlin, Germany. This area is very vibrant and has a lot of Middle Eastern restaurants. The entire area is quite lively.  We actually ate at Maroush both nights in a row. I always say "Stay with folks you know". 😉 The grilled fish is delicious and the salads are very fresh. They give you large portions. I like that it is open late, like past 11 pm. Only negative is that people smoke and the open air style of eating means you can't avoid the cigarette smoke. Other than the strong smoke, the food here is worth a visit if you're ever in Berlin.

Maroush makes THE BEST KEBABS in all of Berlin. If you want kebabs? This is your place. I’ve lived in Budapest, Prague and Berlin, and quite frankly a kebab. I’ve had kebabs, I’ve been around kebabs, I know kebabs and these are the best kebabs in Berlin.
Excellent taste. Value for money. Sitting area is dirty though.
Fresh food. Good customer service. Relatively fast preparation process. Smiling staff
Great falafel. Better then most. But still similar places are easy to find in Berlin ( that just means competition is high).
Amazing Kebabs. The best I've had so far. Durum wrap is thin. Donor is toasted crispy. There was a wait for in the queue but it worth the wait. We are so fast there wasn't any time to take pictures.

There's a reason this place has a line from the moment it opens until it shuts down at the end if the night. Delicious, affordable kebab. Don't hesitate to come here any time you need a pick me up. And really, who couldn't use more delicious food in their life?
Cant get enough! Cheep and tasty! Only problem is the cue, victim of its own popularity. Service is fast though

Went here on a busy Saturday night. And ended up waiting for 1 hours 15 minutes to order. But as soon as you order you get your food. The kebap though is worth the wait. Meat was thinly sliced was very moist and succulent. Tastes just amazing. Overall experience a must when you go to Berlin.

This is the best kebab I’ve had in my life and from London where kebab tends to be pretty good. They had two options on the menu, one being veggie and the other meat. There must have been some sort of aubergine or something in the meat one that really complemented the idea whole vibe. Will be running back here next time I’m in Berlin !!!

Food was okay but service needs to be improved. I asked the bar guy for a table and then went downstairs to get cash (they don’t accept cards) when I came back it was taken and the next table was also reserved.
Punk doesn’t necessarily mean rude, the service lady on the other hand was very pleasant.
Great place, lovely people, hot delicious food, cheap good beer - what’s not to like? Recommended.
