Alternative bar with good burgers, beers and plenty of different cocktails on a very reasonable price.

If you want a good one, ask for the Zombie.
Ordered a vegan burger and they gave me a beef burger. Terrible service, I would never order from them again.

I love easy going restaurants, and usually I don’t complain about service or food. Not in this case, unfortunately.
The food was ok - the sauce over the spareribs was too dense, looked very artificial; the “beilagen” where not well cooked (broccoli: frizen, hard to cut/ chew), the plate were the salad was served was messy and not ready for being served in a restaurant, with mayonnaise at the bottom of the dish, like the dishes would have been piled up (this is definitely what Can happen at home, but it’s not ok in a restaurant!), etc. 
The service was... not good. Very sorry to say that. Our waiter seemed pretty confused, didn’t understand what we where ordering (in German, with Germans at the table) and one of them was extremely impolite.
Fair prices, nice service, decent food without much embellishments.
Food was good and service was nice. However, their policy doesn't allow to change french fries to a salad. This is very weird for a steak house and bad for everyone that tries to live healthy.

good steaks, low prices.
Service-average level

The main reason to go here are the really really low prices. This applies to both food and drinks - especially cocktails. Overall you get what you pay for. Food is OK but nothing to write home about. The cocktails are strong but you can taste that no quality ingredients are used. The interior is decorated nicely and there is a decently sized outdoor seating area along the sidewalk.
This is the hotel next to my ex-company. I stayed there for a night when I was first in Berlin. The hotel has basic facilities for you to stay comfy and they had breakfast buffet. Very nice one.

Good place in the convenient and hip Kreuzburg neighborhood. In spite of it being 90°F in Berlin for a couple of days and this hotel not having A/C, room temperature was comfortable. Little fridge in room was broken but they were able to exchange it with a working one. No noise from the street, but some noise from disrespectful guests who arrive late at night. Courtyard echoes the sound and the card-scanning for opening doors was loud at night. Staff is helpful, beds are comfortable, everything is very clean and smells welcoming. Great wi-fi!
Well, nice room and good breakfest, but also awful stairs - not for people with moving disabilities.
Very unusuall hotel in nice part of Berlin. It is like flash to the past - back to industrial revolution. Hotel is in old chockolate factory. And very pleasant. Real Berlin!

I've been at the cafe several times for brunch on Sunday morning and it's really good. There's quality food that gets refilled pretty regularly and there are cold and hot dishes. If you go there in winter, you even get to try the chocolate fondue fountain which is done with Sarotti chocolate. Really worth a shot if you've never been there!

Too spicy! :) Beware. Undoubtedly, it’s better to ask the server in advance concerning how spicy the exact dish is. And I didn’t do that...
In general the atmosphere is not bad, as if you are at home. We visited the restaurant in the evening on the working day, the place wasn’t overcrowded. 
The food was ok. I’ve ordered some chicken and a cocktail. Chicken came with several interesting side dishes. Unfortunately, some ingredients of the cocktail I wanted, appeared to be out of stock, so the server advised me another one. Some cocktail with hibiscus syrup adding rum, pretty nice taste. 
Also wanna highlight a good serving. The girl was extremely friendly and nice. Spoke pure English! Thanks God! :)

I went here for Christmas eve and there were set menus. The menus were interesting and tasty but mainly the starters were not Christmas worthy. Even though it was Christmas the prices for the menus were a little steap. Atmosphere in the restaurant was fun but a little stressed out as the waiters were running around and walking up and down a lot without any purpose. Nevertheless we have a good time and fun during Christmas eve.
Very nice staff! And the typical Jamaican cuisine, like plantanas fritas and the curry chicken (which I went for - it was amazing). Very relaxed prices and atmosphere.

Everything was absolutely perfect. Best restaurant we've done in Berlin instep year's time. The owner is just great, he spend so much explaining us everything. Service was really quick. Food was amazing. The wines were absolutely breathtaking.

It's notoriously hard to find good spicy food in Berlin, the city doesn't seem to like it. This place however ticks all the boxes. It's a little more expensive than other restaurants nearby but the ambiance, atmosphere and food are totally worth it. They make their own fresh corn bread and hot sauce (which you can also usually buy). The food itself is well presented and packs a lot of flavour and spice as mentioned before. There are more mild options on the menu so don't be put off, but if you want tasty spicy food in Kreuzberg then you should definitely consider it. Great vegan and vegetarian options too which is great. Soundtrack inside is also really fun.

Friendly staff and an excellent selection of Tapas. We were a group of 7 and were well taken care of. There was not much of a bar, but plenty of seating and the atmosphere was lively. Would definitely come again.

Amazingly delicious, authentic Portuguese food! You must try it!
 didn't understand why the place is always full until once I got in... 
We ordered the 4 vegetarian plates and they were served oven-hot, and they were extremely delicious!

We have been offered to take the worst table next to the exit near a fridge though there were free tables in the restaurant. After we got a better table we have been ignored and didn’t even get a menu. Have left after 10 minutes waiting. Extremely unfriendly service.
A Portuguese vibe in the center of Friedrichshain. Tapas and Vine are excellent ! We had the hot goat cheese with honey tapas... Delicious.

The food and wine are fine and on the pricey side. The attitude of the owner however (and we’ve been several times) ranges from extremely friendly to rude to starting verbal fights and yelling across the restaurant at us the last time we went. Perhaps there is something going on with the owner, but taking it out on the customers is quite unprofessional and left a bad taste in our mouths.

I just freaking LOVE this place.

My opinion, strong opinion, I don’t care: Best schnitzel in Berlin. There are some great choices but I just love how it’s nicely lightly done. 
Atmosphere is 5 stars. Minimal white design with comfy distribution and a cigar lounge at the back where you can finish your drinks after dinner (wine is exceptional and service is prima)

If you visit me to berlin (and I like you) then I will indeed take you here.
Without a doubt one of the best restaurants in Friedrichshain. Fine dining in a super nice way.
We had a great evening at Schneeweiß, few choices in food but great quality. Excellent wine choices and great service. Bit too warm inside for our liking...
Cost place and great food. Price is really good for the quality of food you get.
Really nice restaurant, friendly staff who are happy to make recommendations and delicious food! Visited with a group of friends and then with my husband, had a good experience on both occasions.

My first brunch experience but definitely not the last. Everything about this place was amazing. The food is really delicious and there is such a variety of dishes you can choose. The staff is really kind and really heartwarming. Totally worth the price and the visit. Highly recommended.
Was there for a dancing party. Loved the place. Spacious, clean, great floors for a dance!
Lovely spot for brunch and great beer garden in the summer
Wonderful outside seating and great beer!
Absolutely great for Sunday brunch!! The food is delicious and there is such a variety! Very nice service!
Nice staff, good Currywurst, fair pricing 2.50€/Currywurst. All fine no complains, if nearby, surely again...

Really nice and spicy food, perfect for a quick bite! The place is easy to find and is in a perfect location, not far away from the busy street, but still in a remote corner.
Everyone is really friendly, a pleasure to be there! 
Thank you and see you next time!
Great people, and a wonderful Berlin Currywurst experience.  When you need a quick delicious snack, this is a good place to stop by.
Probably the best one you will find in Berlin, in other cities you could probably find something better.
A sausage is never enough! Ask for the spicy chili sauce 👌🏿

Really special and intimate Nordic-German tapas - genuine farm to table from local Saxon agriculture - the like of which you will find nowhere else in Berlin especially for the price. Seasonal and creative and the wine menu is really an adventure through the local regions. Very relaxed and helpful service a must stop for the gastronomically savvy on any berlin journey.
Great 7 course meal. Super fine and delicious. Recommended!!
Smaller menu BUT everything on it is great!  Nice intimate setting, great service, very good selection of wines - a great meal out!!  Upmarket menu with reasonable prices

Es gibt ein regionales 7 Gang Menü für ca. 36 Euro plus weinbegleitung für 25 sehr gute Küche in nicht so steifer Atmosphäre.. Der Service könnte etwas freundlicher sein und manche Sachen wie zum Beispiel das Besteck passen gar nicht.. Aber zu zweit für 150 Euro kann man klasse Küche genießen
Immer wieder ein Erlebnis. Sehr gute Küche, exzellenter Service, sehr gute Weinbegleitung.
Nice, cosy place. Don't go downstairs if you are a non smoker. Upstairs is smoke free.
Food filled with an amazing explosion of flavors. If you are looking for new and delicious experiences this is the place. You can also come to have a beer or a tee in very cozy Berliner environment.

Best arabic food ever! Amazing experiences, great hummus. I've never tried some tasty falafel as theirs!!  The atmosphere is cozy and relaxed, the service is a bit slow but the guys were friendly and chilled. They made the difference of that place, compared to many others. Prices are super affordable as the meal were made with lots of love and quality goods! Highly recommend for a dinner or just a nice talk with friends - cool with for small talks or big ones (groups, parties can be hosted amazingly).
I'm new in Google map , but its very good and it takes anywhere easily.
Good food quality; dishes are very good there. The service need improvement though!
This is the hotel next to my ex-company. I stayed there for a night when I was first in Berlin. The hotel has basic facilities for you to stay comfy and they had breakfast buffet. Very nice one.

Good place in the convenient and hip Kreuzburg neighborhood. In spite of it being 90°F in Berlin for a couple of days and this hotel not having A/C, room temperature was comfortable. Little fridge in room was broken but they were able to exchange it with a working one. No noise from the street, but some noise from disrespectful guests who arrive late at night. Courtyard echoes the sound and the card-scanning for opening doors was loud at night. Staff is helpful, beds are comfortable, everything is very clean and smells welcoming. Great wi-fi!
Well, nice room and good breakfest, but also awful stairs - not for people with moving disabilities.
Very unusuall hotel in nice part of Berlin. It is like flash to the past - back to industrial revolution. Hotel is in old chockolate factory. And very pleasant. Real Berlin!

I've been at the cafe several times for brunch on Sunday morning and it's really good. There's quality food that gets refilled pretty regularly and there are cold and hot dishes. If you go there in winter, you even get to try the chocolate fondue fountain which is done with Sarotti chocolate. Really worth a shot if you've never been there!

Historical place to visit.. Nice environment, great crown all over year. Tourists and history loving people just love this place because of its involvement in different sectors like politics, revolution, reunify, war etc. Great to watch the beauty. The good thing is the location of its also not very far from the 'Parliament'.

Nice area and patrolled by security constantly.  Plenty of ways to get there public and private transit.  There is more to see near the tower and leads to the surrounding area.  Take a stroll and enjoy the sights and sounds.

Berlin is beautiful city and this gate is its main attraction. This Brandenburg gate is located in main city of Berlin. This is gate is surrounded by different souvenir shops, cafes, famous brands for shopping. The architecture of Brandenburg gate is eyes touching, once you see this you will never forget it. It is photogenic location you can click best pictures there.

What a great place into the heart of the Berlin. The whole area around Brandenburg is it full of the surprises and places to see. Watch once upon a time a dividing point between the west and east bedlinen and today the artery of Berlins tourist attractions. Definitely the place you have to visit if you are visiting Berlin.

This is an impressive landmark in Berlin and is a must see, for any tourist.  It's extraordinary to think that the Berlin wall was right here by the Brandenburg gate itself.  There are tourist information signage all around this area to give you the history of the Brandenburg gate itself.  This is also a place where you can get a ride with some very alternative methods of transport, like those crazy bikes with several cyclists in a circular formation.
Hope Russia will be a normal free country one day. And...... leave the Ukraine and other countries alone.

Killers, criminals،
SYRIA WiLL BE FREE one day
Beautiful building, saw a memorial for the St Petersburg attack while I was there.
Are these you came Don Cook.These are you came Thank You! The as a came gave!
Embassy of Russian Federation which is situated in magnificent building in great localisation. Worth to see even from the outside.

Berlin is great also because it offers quite a few opportunities for reflecting silently on history, on humanity, on evils past and on the need to be constantly on our guard (this is the link with the German word "Wache" I like to make, in this case) in order to try and prevent any such occurrence in future... which, by the way, seems to be humankind's favourite failure.
the history of Berlin is so incredibly interesting and makes the visit to any monument really a must see. Even this small one.
Very beautiful and meaningful memorial worth taking a minute to check out.
Suitably quiet. Good for quiet reflection.
Interesting monument, makes you think about the stupidity of war and violence.
Beautiful place with a lot of artifacts. Very nice organized space. Really very nice new part of museum with photo exhibition. Good price, good place - well done!

Nice section on the Holocaust although you had to look for it.   But I feel a need to remind them about the Berlin Airlift and The Marshall Plan.  Those events hardly got a mention.  And to lump the USA into 'other nations' in the World War 1 section is ignoring the industrial and financial help that was given.

Fantastic and interesting artifacts with the history of Germany. We used the English audio tour and found it most helpful and very informative. 

We were there nearly 5 hours and didn't finish all of the audio clips$

Really well done museum. Covers the history of Germany from the Middle Ages until reunification. Most artifacts and such have descriptions in English and German. It’s worth the extra €3 for the audio guide. Discounts for students and children free. Plan at least 2 hours. Would be good rainy or cold day activity. There is a cafés and a coat check.
A really great museum. Lots of things to see and learn. I spent half a day there but I feel there is still so much more.
Go learn the history of this church. It's fascinating!
The cathedral was closed without explanations, many people were wondering if it was actually possible to visit or not. Seriously, who keep closed a church on Sunday?
Amazing time of evening whel light show just began
A peaceful cathedral to disconnect with the material world connect with the higher diving!
Stunning building and amazing some, well worth photographing with an ultra wide or fisheye lens.
I can’t believe there is always beautiful classical music spread in the air from an open window of some rehearsal happening around there.... very nice Christmas market too.

The Christmas market here is one of my favourite. It usually opens towards the end of November and it's a must for any mulled wine lover in the area 👌 
They also have a stand in particular selling beautiful Christmas decorations and even a little stage with either baked or classical music going on in the evening. I definitely recommend it!
Great during Christmas market time! The most popular one. Go during the week if you want to avoid the crowd.
Went to the Christmas market. Very nice at that time of year. Might be a bit quieter otherwise, but still good range of shops with a nice atmosphere.
Very cool area to visit. Beautiful buildings and a nice open public square to sit in on a sunny day.

This is actually very close to the Konzerthaus Berlin, and there is another domes building right across. These are the main venue for concerts in Berlin we did not get to see it from the inside because it was closed when we got there, but you can still appreciate the beautiful architecture of these buildings.
Extremely beautiful building and environment around it!

An eye-catching cathedrals you can see in Europe, specially its outside view. We went to Berlin in christmas holidays and unfortunately it was closed therefore we couldn't visit its inside. During the christmas holidays the set up an outdoor marketplace for foods, drinks, clothes and etc. which was really amazing.
I think it is worth to visit this cathedral and its neighborhood while you are in Berlin.
The building itself is worth visiting and the area around is quite nice. Also it is in a walking distance from the Museum Island which is another popular destination.
One the the best Cathedrals I have seen from the outside. Unfortunately it was closed for restoration when I went in December.

Nice pearl in the middle of Berlin. Good overview of early communication history up to present day. Mainly focus on German communication history. Good to check out the Schatzkammer downstairs. Also nice to come with kids, there are two friendly robots meeting you ;-)

Excellent Exhibition, ground floor have many train, train fans must visit. Other floors also have many exhibition, major on various inventions in history. Very educational.C-47 on roof, you can't miss it.
Very good museum. It has some interesting phone and postal service artifacts, but it's not overwhelming, so 1:30h is more than enough for a visit.

reviews.author_name: Sir Edington's this n that UK
reviews.text: Beautiful building and well cared for exhibits however it felt lacking in content and some of information on the displays also could of been more informative for example the computer time line showed Leo with no explanation and also not a mention of ARM which seemed very odd.
Very nice Museum with interesting activities. Not only for adults but kids as well.

Pretty spectacular seeing pieces from Babylonia and Assyria. Although I can't help but wonder if it was right to remove the objects from their original location in the first place. I do appreciate the opportunity to learn about these objects.

Short visit in comparison to the other museums of the island but incredible experience. The scale of art pieces represented there in nothing short of amazing. Reconstitution of the Ishtar Gate is awe-inspiring!
Take the Berlin Welcome Card and book your visit on a specific time to avoid all queues during busy days. Well worth the visit.

One of the most unique displays I have seen. But tickets online as line can be very long! The most interesting parts are the structural displays, but the entire museum is very good, could have spent a long time going through the detailed audio guide
Awesome museum, definitely get the audio guide, it's free! If you're gonna go to at least one more museum it's worth getting the museum Island ticket. Worth a visit for sure, amazing experience.

Too bad nobody talks about the fact that the entrance is Closed until about 2025. The museum is impressive but really short compared to the 20 eur price. Probably will be amazing after all the renovations.
Don't skip the panorama, it was really nice and well thought. Cool idea and really cool experience for everyone.

This used to be located in a post WW II building in Dahlem, and the southern Pacific collection is very impressive and contains several large sailing canoes for long distance travel. This part of the museum may now be preparing to move to the Alexander von Humboldt Forum presently under construction. One of Berlin´s main highlights.
The Museum für Vor- und Frühgeschichte ("Museum for prehistory and early history"), part of the Berlin State Museums, is one of major archaeological museums. Wikipedia
Cool
Sehr schön
Interessanter Ort

Great museum, with valuable art collections, paintings by famous artists. It is located in a historical building with beautiful architecture,  on the museum island. Upper floors are accessible by nicely decorated stairs, but also by lift, for people with limited mobility.

An unique gallery in which there are lots of masterpieces from a lot famous artist such as Canova. It is very cheap and there is a good audio guide. 

Also like other museum, it closes around 18:00

Absolutely a must in Berlin
Excellent atmosphere, amazing exhibits. Totally recommended. Big issue in communication with the staff (below average knowledge of the English language). After all you are working in a museum

Actually, I rate this museum at a zero. Very rude staff. I was asked to keep my purse in front of me with no explanation. While walking, my purse and strap slipped to my side. The same man ran to me and literally  yelled at me.  I was quite startled.
 Apparently,  the few pieces of chain on my purse strap could trip a museum alarm. He could have calmly told me this the first time. His voice caused such a scene that groups of people started at me.  He was very loud, unprofessional and just plain ugly.  I was embarrassed as well as my family.  We  were so startled by his actions, we left the museum.  We will not return. I wonder if the man does this to other visitors. I am appalled that I was treated this way. How embarrassing for him. Is this how the director of the museum wants his employees to act? The staff should be proactive and let museum goers know about these things upon entering.
I loved this museum, especially the second floor with all the French Impressionists like Monet Manet Renoir. The audio guides are free and very clear. A place to visit in Berlin

Beautiful catholic church built in the early 1800s. The architecture and the huge dome immediately catches the eye. One of the most popular tourist attractions in Berlin right at the Museum island.
There are many things to see inside the church. The church itself, a museum, a crypt and the panoramic view deck at the top. The church inside is gorgeous with a stunning organ pipe cluster. The dome is decorated with beautiful glass and wall paintings and walls are a great example of craftsmanship. The crypt is well maintained and is worth a visit. The panoramic views from the top are good too...and with 181 stairs...be ready to climb a bit! The entry ticket is €7 per person.
There's an automatic ticket machine and a locker section before the entrance...better to take the ticket here and then enter inside to jump the queue. Also, you can go straight in if you don't want to wait for the audio guide device. There's a souvenir store and a cafe at the exit with expensive stuff as expected.
This church is definitely one of the best things to see in Berlin.

It's a beautiful church. You'll find tons of nice churches in the country and all over Europe, but this was one of the absolute best ones on my trip. The architecture is beautiful, and the church is very big. You can go all the way to the top and look out over the city. I highly recommend to anyone who likes to admire beautiful churches or architecture.

It is an impressive cathedral and one of the major attractions. Area surrounding it is well maintained. In the light of evening sun it is a good place for photographers. Fountains and park in front is good time pass. Very close to museum island. Inside too is very impressive.

Beautiful church with great view from the top. You will have to climb a lot of stairs, but it is worth it. If you want to go to the toilets here, you have to pay 0.5 € even if you pay the ticket, and that is something that seemed weird for me, but everything is clean. Anyway, the view from the top is fantastic and you can have a really great time there.
Absolutely beautiful! A big highlight of my trip to Berlin. Incredible from the inside and out. Highly recommend buying tickets to enter and climbing to the very top. The view is incredible.
Fascinating work! It makes you actually more curious to dig up more details about it! The facial expression of the sculptures are mesmerizing!
Nice fountain to honor Neptune. Personally is I think the one in Madrid is better, but clearly is just a preference :)
I wish it had water though. I took a coffee to the place, it makes a good reading spot during non peak hours
Nice market, not been there before despite visiting Berlin several times in the past.
The details are fascinating, metal is bend to have wrinkles like cloth. I enjoyed

Beautiful church! Was lucky enough to make it for a baroque organ show when I was there. (The sign said they have this on Thursday and Friday's at around 5). The musician invited us upstairs to get a close look at the pipe organ and he explained how it works. He also played some beautiful pieces on it!!! What a lovely experience! The show was free, but leaving a donation allows them to maintain the pipe organ.

Conveniently placed close to Alexander Platz, it is a great option to go in and collect your thoughts or light a candle for someone you love. Intrigued by the drawing at the entrance, which seems to depict a fun extraterrestrial party. Very X-Files.
Oldest church in Berlin, located near Alexanderplatz. Very beautiful inside. You can find here several interesting paintings. Absolutely recommend to visit this calm place.

Beautuful medival church in the heart of Berlin city Center, right next to alexanderplatz and fernseheturm. One of the oldest churches in Berlin. Inside the church you can find breathtaking baroque organs where famous musicians used to take their first organ classes, as well as famous fresco painting - the dance of death.

I’m not a Christian. 

But I prayed and the main reason why I prayed was the air. 

The air makes me think too deep. 

It’s free to go into the church. 

Also the tower is not that far from here.

Wouldn’t recommend. Church structure is rebuilt with concrete and now a museum, nor longer a church. It cost 5 € entrance fee and nothing in there worth seeing. Outside is nice and couple cafes in the areas look nice. 
Bottom line, take a picture of the exterior and don’t wast your time going in.
Nice place in Berlin. Small cu te quarter that gives you completely different view of Berlin
Great historical monument. This church is worth visiting.

church and the area, specially Eiergasse has a long story which could not be understood just by seeing.
I recommend reading more about it or take a tour which has this area included.
Beautiful place full of history  with friendly insightful staff. I greatly recommend visiting it.

We just found it interesting and different, so we went to visit it. The entrance is just for 4,50 euros and even though the museum is small, it has a lot of things to learn about. 
They also have a little shop where you can get products made with it, really good idea!

We were in Berlin for a International Cannabis Business Conference (ICBC) and a group of us visited the Hemp Museum.  It is a small museum but our tour was interesting and very informative.  We had our own tour guide because we were there with such a big group.  It costs between 3 and 5 Euro to get in depending if you are with a group.   The staff are volunteers and they were just wonderful.  Couldn't have made us feel any more welcome and really took their time to teach us everything about the history and many uses of Hemp.  After the tour we went downstairs to the little coffee shop where we enjoyed a Hemp Tea!  I highly recommend the tea, it was easy to drink.   I think many people would be very surprised about the many many uses of the Hemp plant.  The tour takes about an hour and its educational  so go and check it out.
This museum gives you the opportunity to learn more about hemp and also taste some hemp seeds!

Very small but lovely little museum. Highly recommend them to publicise themselves more.

Nice little gift shop, I purchased some balm, some sweets and really nice hemp seed snacks.
Fun to visit :) lots of pipes :)

A cool place for cool people to visit. We tend to choose historic locations, while contemporary art tells a lot about our past and present in a unique way. This museum is pretty unique, with amazing artists in the permanent exhibition. The temporary one about AI and our future made a big impact on me. Check which one is there before visiting.

Pretty huge place full of famous art pieces. Worth to visit for all day. U can buy tickets just for some separated exhibitions if u dont want to spend the whole day there. Take a comfy shoes and have a great time.
Such a gem. Permanent and rotating collections are just perfect. Really amazing space as well.

A big museum of contemporary art with paintings, video art and installations

It in a former huge train station which gives a great feeling to the museum. 
I wasn't that impressed by the permanent collection though although it was ok and its a personal view. 
Hosts temporary exhibitions. Check on the internet site before

It’s huge and rich. You need to buy a ticket. Friendly staff. 
Recommended

cool cafe! If you like the Ramones then you will enjoy seeing all the memorabilia. You'd pay €4 for a drink - so why not pay €7 for a drink, a pin badge and see some cool stuff and listen to some punk rock 😁

Super chilled cafè with museum attached. Entrance is 5€, 7€ with a drink. The decor is the coolest thing if you are into punk rock. The walls are signed by loads of bands who played the venue and there's plenty of cool memorabilia.

This is a must see for a fan of the Ramones, or any punk music. Coffee & drinks are great, the museum price is reasonable. The decor is cool and comfortable. The music is rocking. The museum itself is small but it's a good size packed with interesting information about the Ramones. Filled with tour posters, articles & t-shirts!
Very cool. Lots of great pics and posters. Cool little cafe.
Awsome place to drink beer, contemplate your life and meet Matt Cameron ❤

They wanted 250 EUR to repair my Z5 phone that was working and only had a cracked back panel. A new Z5 costed 350 EUR at the time. No problem with the front screen whatsoever. I showed them my old Z2 from 5 years ago, my wireless Sony headphones, told them I only buy Sony, and this is the price they give an old customer? My phone even had a guarantee! Never, ever buying Sony again.

A must see place in Berlin. One of the most busiest and happening places with trendy crowd. Many events are conducted around this building complex and also in its basement. The unique roof of this complex is a spot for vast number of photos. We have restaurants, cinema halls and lots of shopping.
Prices are a bit higher than the retail shops but there are deals that's make it very affordable, bought the WH-1000XM3  ;)

Great store that celebrates the Sony brand and the latest innovations across multiple stores. They have special sales offers too and demo areas. I did not buy anything, but liked the vibe of that place a lot.
Super futuristic and modern, so many products, great service
The staffs are a bit rude. Beethoven original symphony is here

Library itself is great, but many people just leave their books and took the space. It was not easy to find a place to study. Those who took space are being unconsidered to other library users. If you are not gonna stay here for the rest 2 hours, why don't you take your stuff and put them in locker?
Refused at entrance if you're not student at Humboldt university or paying Berlin reading club member.
It is definitely the place to be before exams. Amazing conditions, helpful staff and well educated visitors, last but not least, many lockers.

#Stabi Unter den Linden Berlin, rare books/music section just afforded me a nasty experience! I wanted to use my waiting time nicely by studying printed manuscript of Winterreise and was very rudely and abusively talked to by personal because she couldn't remember having seen me there (even though i have spoken to her about books I needed many times). It was like a criminal investigation!! Had to leave feeling sad and shaken. Definitely not the library experience you expect as a researcher 😰

A great place to visit with a fantastic range of interesting artifacts, pretty much something for everyone with clothing, furniture, porcelain and religious artifacts.
There are some really interesting exhibitions from time to time, especially the jewellery exhibition that is not usually my thing but I really enjoyed it.
The staff are all friendly and the exhibits are displayed really well in a way that let's you really see them up close.

It's not the first time I visit this little gem - the museum has a very well curated beautifully presented permanent exhibition of several epochs, divided by period and style, over 4 floors. Sounds big, but it's totally doable within 2 hours even.
The highlight is their vast fashion collection and quality furniture collection.
Eventhough I know the permanent exhibition well, I visited lately the focus exhibition on jewelry. They integrated this special exhibition, as other 3 focus changing exhibitions, into the permanent one, so you don't pay any extra.
Entrance at 8€ is well invested.

This review is very subjective. I went here on a cold wednesday morning and was the only one there except for the security guards. It's huge with its four huge floors and have many different artifacts from many different era's. It did however feel very stuffy and was lacking a story. Not interactive and unless you are a person who can appreciate the workmanship of a vase, you won't enjoy it very much. Not my cup of tea.

A well curated museum in an interesting building.  If you have an interest in the decorative arts or fashion history, well worth a visit.  If it is not your area of interest, I would suggest another museum in the area.
The modern design section is very good but fairly small.  The rest we did not find that interesting

Great museum, with valuable art collections, paintings by famous artists. It is located in a historical building with beautiful architecture,  on the museum island. Upper floors are accessible by nicely decorated stairs, but also by lift, for people with limited mobility.

An unique gallery in which there are lots of masterpieces from a lot famous artist such as Canova. It is very cheap and there is a good audio guide. 

Also like other museum, it closes around 18:00

Absolutely a must in Berlin
Excellent atmosphere, amazing exhibits. Totally recommended. Big issue in communication with the staff (below average knowledge of the English language). After all you are working in a museum

Actually, I rate this museum at a zero. Very rude staff. I was asked to keep my purse in front of me with no explanation. While walking, my purse and strap slipped to my side. The same man ran to me and literally  yelled at me.  I was quite startled.
 Apparently,  the few pieces of chain on my purse strap could trip a museum alarm. He could have calmly told me this the first time. His voice caused such a scene that groups of people started at me.  He was very loud, unprofessional and just plain ugly.  I was embarrassed as well as my family.  We  were so startled by his actions, we left the museum.  We will not return. I wonder if the man does this to other visitors. I am appalled that I was treated this way. How embarrassing for him. Is this how the director of the museum wants his employees to act? The staff should be proactive and let museum goers know about these things upon entering.
I loved this museum, especially the second floor with all the French Impressionists like Monet Manet Renoir. The audio guides are free and very clear. A place to visit in Berlin

If you're into science and natural history, this is one of the most exciting museums in Berlin you 'd have to see! You can spend here few hours, as in every room there is something else to see! There are 3d printed dinosaur bones (you can see a 3d scanning lab inside), Tristan the T-Rex

Great museum, although we expected it to be bigger. We spend about three hours in here, but it was worth it. The exhibits are well designed and the museum looks very neat. The dinosaur collection as well as the collection of mounted animals was very interesting. Unfortunately, the taxidermy exhibit had signs only in German, but luckily the other exhibits were in English as well.

Tristan the T Rex and his friends, the biggest standing dinosaurs :) You need few hours to see everything. Good for kids and teens as well. You can see lots of rocks from around the world, all sea animals, lots of stuffed land animals and insects, how Universe and Earth began.

As the name suggests, this museum's focus is on paleontology, geology, and evolution. The exhibits are a little outdated in some ways, but a good primer for children who are starting to learn about these topics. The dinosaur skeletons and the geode room were particularly nice; the specimen room is appropriately creepy.
Admission was pretty high for what's here, but not unreasonable.

I love this museum. It's not that big, it takes approximately 2-3 hours, but it's one of my favorites! There is the biggest mounted dinosaur in the world, most preserved archeopteryx, T-Rex named Tristan, huge mineral collection from around the world and so. There is plenty of children activities, every day.

Interesting Exhibition of modern art. Like they told here’s the most popular paintings in Berlin.
Sometimes it’s hard to understand this kind of art, but it costs real money which understand everyone)
Top
Super spannende Exponate. Sehr erlesen Auswahl an Werken. Konnte mich kaum trennen.
Je m’oblige toujours un détour par ce lieu magnifique
Schöne Kunst
nice art gallery

Kostenfreier Zugang zu Kunst und Kultur im Wedding! :)
Interessante Ausstellungen, welche sich lohnen bei Vorbeikommen besucht zu werden.
Gute Kunst gibt's hier ,netter Laden.
Was sich so alles Kunst nennt ^^
Eine sehr kleine Galerie, aber mit interessanten Ausstellungen. Der Eintritt ist frei
This was an awesome currywurst! The curry powder had a real bang to it! They have free habenero sauce with it!
Great food, great price and the person serving was very nice to us! Delicious sauces
Nice! Enjoyed it! Gluten free sausages
Great sausages, friendly staff. Nice and fresh and great quality. My son loves eating here with me as a treat!!:-)

Food was good, I got what I expected, in comparison to other similar restaurants its a tad more expensive, but the ingredients were supposed to be of better quality. The place was quite crowded on a Friday afternoon.

Great place to try German beers and dishes if you are visiting. Trying to order the cheapest beer during the ‘beer stock market’ is fun. Go for the sausage platter if you can’t choose which sausage you want to have

meal and ambiance are nice! place located very central and next to river. service nice also has very friendly attitude. and order coming very fast. its surprise. and meal quality price rate very good.
Great place to grab a drink and quick snack. Beer flight was great, and Flammekuchen was pretty good as well. A bit pricey, and wish we came during the beer stock market, but would certainly go back.

A very busy and lively bar but well worth the visit and the Beer stock market on the large tv screens are great especially when it's a Crash and the price falls.
Great range of beers and a nice menu,you can reserve a table if eating or just enjoy a drink at the bar, great staff.
Good beer, good food but service a little slow. Would go back again though. Lots of character.

I’m a bit confused because I go there at least monthly and mostly the steaks are exceptional, but sometimes they are overcooked and dry. More consistency would be appreciated. Generous wine selection. Outstanding service.
The food was very good. Served hot and each plate premiered with care. The staff was relaxed and talkative. 4/5 because we waited a lot more for our main courses to arrive

I have been there a few times, unfortunately the last time they trimmed down their entire menu and removed *everything* I liked.

*Please* bring back your Mac&Cheese and your Key Lime pie!
Excellent service, great prices and the meat was just amazing! Very much recommended! As an added bonus its a stones throw away from the Postamerplatz Station!
It is an up scale Steak restaurant in Berlin. Especially Kobe steak was delicious. Little pricy but not too high. It is ground floor of a 5 star hotel where there is also a great cigar bar.

The location, the place and the interior are amazing. The service has always been good too... But the dishes we ordered didn't taste very well. I could taste high quality ingredients there but the combination of tastes and flavors was not enjoyable... unfortunately. The restaurant also looked a bit "sad".
Really nice breakfast buffet. Food was excellent. The place was spacious and had no trouble getting a table. Also has an outdoor area. Complimentary newspaper.

Good, simple food, well prepared with good ingredients. Good service too.
Four stars only though as prices do suggest outstanding food and outstanding service.

As a main plate I chose the white halibut served with mini fennel, tomato vinaigrette, pulpo and mussels. A chunk of fish, a light golden envelope, lying on a bed of vegetables, some mussels and chunks of cooked octopus. Lemony, juicy and full of taste. Diced tomatoes and crunchy fennel, lots of lemon and surely extra love. A delicious plate up to fine dining standards.

Cozy place, delicious food, and great ambience. We would certainly recommend your restaurant to our colleagues and each time I’m in your country, I will certainly attempt to dine with you again. Thank you for making our day to special.

Great atmosphere and great food at this restaurant that is meant to be the place where Brecht lived when he was in Berlin.

Not so expensive and very good food make this place a great place to go in Berlin.

Reservation Needed
Isabelle and our waiter were wonderful. The streak and shrimp were divine. Excellent! Would definitely recommend.

One of Berlin’s best restaurants; meat and seafood are great quality. Service is absolutely good. 
Problem is the opening hours, why can’t I have lunch in the place? Or at least late lunch?
SUPER RESTAURANT! EXQUISITE WINES! DELICIOUS FOOD! THE BEST PORTER STEAKHOUSE EVER! PERFECT SERVICE!
excellent food and selection of wines. the staff was superb. we had a splendid evening.

In general the food was good, a highpoint of the seafood platter and a low of the pineapple with marshmallows, which could have done without being some pineapple chopped up with marshmallow. Which I guess they did advertise, but could have done with other flavours and textures. The seafood was great. however.
Excellent food.  Lovely atmospheres. Fair prices. Just perfect. I would highly recommend
Restaurant's setting is really pleasant. I found the couscous tasted very good, they could probably be more generous with the portion though.
Really nice place with delicious food and cosy atmosphere. Good tea creme brulee and tajin. Will recomend it.
Very good food, they only need to improve their service.

Pros:
- The staff is very welcoming, good at English and will give you good service. [5/5]
- The food tastes fresh, perfectly cooked and is well seasoned. [4/5]
The atmosphere is warm and looks very pretty. The lighting, colours and furniture is in good harmony and everything feels well thought out. [4.5/5]

Cons:
- None to speak of.

Vietnamese banh mi in Berlin! I have to say, it’s not the best Vietnamese sandwich what I have eaten in my life, kinda dry, tasteless, you can only taste the carrots and the greens.
The service is nice and the main dishes looked good and huge. It seems like we should have ordered a rice dish
Had a lovely little "meal deal." Chicken banh mi, a small, delicious salad, and a tea of your choice (I had a fresh lemongrass tea) all for €8.40. Self-service, cards accepted.

One of the best fast food restaurant in Berlin, with WONDERFUL Asian Sandwiches. Highly recommend for a fast Lunch, dinner or an after work meal. 
Near Rosentaler Platz (U8), Mitte.
Delicious sandwiches. Great place for a quick bite to eat.
Bánh mì shop with plenty of choices. Good sandwiches, but don't really taste like back in Hanoi. Also the bread is different from the ones in Vietnam and too crispy.

This place is pretty impressive for an all you can eat hotpot place - especially since they have seafood as well for 13€. There are a nice array of sauces you can mix together to create your own dipping sauce. 

My only qualms were that when the meat came out it looked like it had been frozen before hand which made the texture a bit strange and that the spicy broth wasn't very spicy.

I am a hotpot lover. And I can’t eat beef  but there is pork in Lucky Star!!!! I was so touched 🤣 I have been many hotpot restaurant in EU but they only have beef or lamp 😭 Also,in Lucky star we can choose soup base👍🏻If I am right they do have 5-6 soup base🤤
Highly recommend that someone like me is looking for nice and affordable hotpot in Berlin . And they have pork!!!🤣

I was working nearby and went here often for the stunning lunch. Starting from 5€ you get a soup and a main dish. It's fabulous! Service is super friendly. I will come back for hot pot some day and it makes me sad to not work nearby anymore...
No nonsense Asian business lunch. Quick and friendly service with excellent value for money.

We came for the hot pot. We were honestly skeptical because on Foursquare the restaurant had a 3.6 rating but after reading that the hot pot was good from majority of the Asians we took the plunge.

For 13.80 All you can eat, this was a steal! The sauce was legit, entirely customizable, and all the ingredients were fresh. There was enough variety as they gave four kinds of meats, seafood, tofu, plenty of veggies, noodles, and RICE CAKES!  We took the hot and normal clear broth.  The hot was perfect and didn't have a heavy numbing flavor which I personally prefer. All in all super worth it for a place in Mitte. Recommend coming a bit earlier because it does get packed.

The best meal I've ever had - vegan or not.  Every dish is a masterpiece. Can't believe it's all made of veggies. Loved it.
Service was great as well, they explained each dish, which added to the experience. 
It's a must when you're in Berlin, especially if you're vegan.

A dry evening as the service always forgot to serve us. We really were looking forward to this evening as we heard and read a lot about kopps. Sadly the service was not unfriendly, but really distant and we always had to ask if we could order more water or other drinks sitting there with empty glasses. We ordered three courses and the food was fine, but far from being one of the best vegan places I have been to. So for me, the place is more show (and pricey) for what it actually in for the customer.

Enjoyed Saturday brunch here, warm welcome, very friendly staff. My guest loved the tasty soup. I delighted in the scrambled tofu. I wish there was a vegan sausage though! Pancakes with berry compôte were delicious. Gets busy for brunch at the weekend, especially after 10am. €18 excl. drinks, cash only, reservations recommended.
High quality, fresh, innovative dishes. Friendly service. Beautiful decor.

Beautiful, varied and yummy food - got the brunch buffet. Cold scrambled egg mush was amazing, cheese and dessert section also really nice. But please don't charge for tap water and refill of tea water, that is just cheap and is why I am giving 4 stars only. Otherwise keep up the good work!

Portions were huge,
Service was good,
Food tasted decent not spicy so if you want it spicy ask for it.. I asked for medium spicy which had no kick which was my mistake. 
Good authentic Indian food overall

It's Okay, the food isn't great but the lunch deal is so cheap that it is easy to overlook the fact that the food is only mediocre. I do miss the soup they used to serve with lunch. If you want a quick affordable bite for lunch it's fine, if you want to enjoy great Indian cuisine go somewhere else.

Lovely ambience and great staff. Food options are good too, specially if you are a single eater (try business lunch then). The Indian milk tea with honey was unexpectedly yummy! I'm giving 4 stars because the Amritsari chole i had was not like how I had it in Amritsar and tasted a bit like it had tomato sauce in it. I guess it was a wrong choice.

As a desi guy I found the medium spicy not actually spicy at all. Otherwise the food was good, the texture was authentic. The amount was quite handsome. The staff was nice. The waiting time was not too much. The incense at the entrance is too much and a bit annoying. The music was nice aswell. Overall highly recommended.

If you want to have Indian food in Berlin, this place is must to visit 😊

The vegan options are good enough for your meal and specially the vegetable biryani. I loved it 😋.
Ambience is colorful and the seating arrangement is quite good.

The Thai curry soup was so warm, comforting, flavourful and delicious (and vegan for all my vegan peers out there). The ambience is great. It is not highly pricey either. A good experience. The photo also has a salad eaten by a friend who loves this salad. It was good too.

Poor service for first timers to the place. We have experience with the style lunch place but this felt unorganised with little patience for questions. It would be fine with experience of eating here. Food is good though
Fast service, great soups. Friendly and card only, so checkout moves quickly. A great healthy lunch.
Great vegetarian restaurant. You can only pay by cc. the food really tasty, staff very nice. We will come back.
Fine place for lunch. Had lentils soup, it's good

A friend recommended us this place, and we are extremely happy we went. We were able to get a table Saturday night without having to wait. The staff are very friendly and vibrant making great recommendations. The menu are in both German and English. The food is mouth watering, full of rich flavours. Cannot wait to go back again.
The food was delicious and the ambiance was lively. The staff are very patient and helpful. A nice place to have dinner and vegetarians get good options as well.
Fast turnaround, nice lunch menu. Lots of tables so generally quick to get seated even during the lunch rush. Food is not amazing for the price but a good choice to be in and out quickly.
I was used to eat here quite often, I've always found it really good... But lately I think they missed something, the service is changed and the food is not anymore good as it was.
Slightly pricier, but still delicious asian food. Expect slower service during lunch hours. With a large group that can easily mean more than an hour to get everything done.
loved the food. the waiters were wonderful and informative. modern cuisine with good twists to make it damn interesting. highly recommended.

the design of the restaurant really beautiful, food very tasty and in high quality, all courses designed as painting. The team in restaurant provides service in a good atmosphere and luxurious. 
I highly recommend about this testaurant.

Made reservation and gave them credit card details as security (large cancellation fee applicable) ,  when we arrived restaurant was closed and our special  birthday meal was cancelled. No communication
Really good food and amazing service - perfect for a special night out

in a neat location just off the gendarmenmarkt, this little gem offers very solid cooking in a modest setting. service is lacklustre; otherwise, would be a great place to rub shoulders with cabinet ministers!!
Great atmosphere-good balance between old decor and modern. The service was excellent and the food was so very good. Yes it’s pricey but if you want to treat yourself, then this is a good option.
Delicious lunch menu totally worth the money

The lunch was very good albeit small portions. We went for pre fixe which worked out great. Service was superb and very attentive. I read some of the reviews and was little disappointed because if I had to make a decision based on the reviews I might not have walked in but I am glad I eat here and would pay the bill just for the ambiance.  If you don't get stuck up on Michelin stars then you will really enjoy your meal and the ambiance and the decor otherwise you will be disappointed. Our sever was Johannes.

There are different high-class restaurants. This one have their own old German atmosphere and a very tasty fresh dishes. The portions aren't so big, that you can't breathe, but also aren't too small, that you are going away hungry. I think three courses are enough. Also, there is a choice of an old and good alcohol, such as armaniak, Obstler, good vibes and others.
Food is not tasty, boring, tiny and long waiting time. only interior is pretty.

Easy train ride to the Treptow park. This memorial is very impressive. It’s a huge area with multiple statues and beautiful trees. There are inscriptions in Russian (I assume) and German. This is a pretty memorial to the Soviet war/soldiers.

Super interesting place. The memorial is huge. It a good place to go to walk with good weather. Don't go if it raining! 
Be aware that you can't drive your bike inside this place. It is a little hidden.
Beautiful memorial in a lovely park. Definitely worth a visit if in Berlin.
The memorial is inside the park. It is surrounded by trees. Very nice to walk around.
A wonderful historical place. I felt very relaxed walking down the track.
Plesent musical performances, have to visit!

Such a beautiful quite place.
The Schloss (Palace) was built in 1826 and designed by Karl Friedrich Schinkel. 
Never too crowded, has a calming atmosphere, lovely areas to stop and relax and even a nice Café.
The place also presents paintings and statues. About 10 minutes walk from there you will find the Glienicke Brücke (Bridge) that was completed in 1907, don't miss the view from it.
Beautiful architecture, peaceful garden and gorgeous view of Wannsee.
Beautiful place

we went here for a wedding. it is a breathtakingly beautiful place. The staff were very professional and friendly. It's a short (50m) walk from the closest bus stop and is also very accessible by car. Loved it!

Among the best botanical gardens in the world. Interesting outdoor spaces but also many indoor collections if you are visiting on a rainy day. Wonderful collection of cacti. Beautiful nature paths. Definitely a worthy part of any visit to Berlin.

This was the best botanical garden that i have visited during early Spring. Its very well priced and the glass houses were brilliant, ferns, cactus, Tropical, so many different rooms and each was throughly enjoyed. 
Take a picnic if the weather if good and even a few beers like i saw some locals. 
The coffee shop also serves lovely cold, big beers) Thumbs up on that and the gift shop has some lovely items.

The outside grounds weren't quite in bloom yet but they were still beautiful. The many and massive greenhouses were amazing. Different regions of the world, different climates and all were meticulously cared for.

Beautiful Botanical garden. They have plants from all continents. It is also interesting in winter time because the glasshouses with plants are huge. So you don't have to be afraid that you wont have anything to see if it's winter.

It is my most visited place in Berlin. I had two times a year ticket and I used it many times. I was there in average 2 times a week. 

The vegan soup is awesome! The houses are the perfect friend in winter months. The gardens are great for the summer. 

For all touristic and local interest's important place! 

You can walk by food from breitenbachplatz

A small folklore museum. Has some traditional dressing and cabinets with religious, toys etc folklore items and some ethnographic exhibits. Focusses on the European identity. 
Although the museum is small its very nicely presented.
Well suited for younger ages.
When visited had 2 temporary exhibitions. One about wool and one about marriage and it's customs which was very interesting.

The museum staff is very friendly and i thank them.

Definitely not one of the top Berlin museum but a nice visit if you are in the area.

The cafe is nice
Nice museum but a bit small since the top floor was not open..the staff member was very friendly

Lovely museum with some nice exhibits. The one about sheep, wool and how clothes are made was especially great and probably very cool for children. Shame that many parts seem to have been under reconstruction and inaccessible. Staff is also very nice and helpful.

If you read through some of my other reviews, you will notice that it is usually important to me that people treat their guests politely.  I am used to qualifying that, at least in my head.  You know, like they were really nice for the culture they are from....

But the staff in this Museum are some of the friendliest staff my wife and I have encountered in ANY museum, ANYWHERE.  

The exhibits are interesting - and they have a few unique pieces you won't find anywhere else in the world.
Kind of different from the description. Good for children to spend time. For adults, it takes you 40 minutes to go there and 30 minutes to finish the tour.

This museum is connected to the University - super crowded with students! Our museum guide was very knowledgeable & passionate (I'm told he's a lecturer at the University) about the cultural history of Ethiopia.

Our visit to this museum went smoothly. Our guesthouse host made everything seems seamless!! If you're staying at a guesthouse, take advantage of the service - !!

Provides a rich history and culture of Ethiopia. Itwas a discovery for me to know which community a coffee pot is from by the shape of it. The student guide who accompanied us was very nice in describing the different sections and items if the museum.

The museum itself was great. 100birr per person. However the museum is located within the university, which would have been fine if the guard at the gates didn’t insist on keeping my partner’s ID. Given all we had given him was a driver’s licence. But if we hadn’t brought that along, we would have had to give him a passport. This guard just sits at the gate, not even slightly secure behind a counter, there was no technology to photocopy the ID and he insisted on hanging onto it. I was incredibly unhappy with that and had left a sour taste as we headed in. What was worse was when we decided to let him keep it, we came across a couple foreigners who told us they had taken a cab straight into the University and were not asked to present any ID let alone had to leave it with someone who had no way of securing it. We went back to the guard and demanded our ID back with those foreigners, and he still wouldn’t give it back to us. So, pro tip, if you want to go in, go with a cab, DO NOT walk in unless if you want to risk having your passport taken from you and just left lying around on a chair next to him where anyone could have just taken like we had seen most foreign IDs were when we left.

I would not support the museum for this reason and I urge the university to change their policy. Photocopy the ID if you have to, but foreigners should not be handing in their passport just to enter the university.
Good collection of cultural artifacts. The displays could be better organized and the absence of a good gift shop is a missed opportunity. Worth a visit.
Kind of disappointing but interesting.
Really nice museum with a very interesting collection. If you are into Zen and Wabi Sabi. The is the place for you! The staff are very friendly! Pity the ground floor was closed.

The pieces are actually very promising but unless you are an art specialist about ancient American cultures, Chinese, Korean and Japane Art, you won't know much about them here.

There's not very much information about anything; when there seems to be, it's in German. I used the Audio Guide in English and found only two audio spots.

The staff is rude and uneducated. They don't tell you about the closed Asian Art room in the ground floor and you can only find out about it when you have the ticket.

Very disappointing.
i have never been there but i wanted to be the first to review. For the emporer

В Музей азиатского искусства в 2006 году объединились два тематически близких музея — Музей искусства Восточной Азии и Музей индийского искусства. Временные рамки коллекции музея впечатляют — начиная с 4 тысячелетия до нашей эры. В музее выставлены предметы искусства из Центральной, Южной и Юго-Восточной Азии.Мне понравилась подборка японской живописи и азиатской керамики.Провел здесь два часа.Отличный музей
Geschlossen obwohl geöffnet bei Google steht:/

Somewhat of a somber place yet relevant. Found this to very educational and extremely interesting. 
The grounds are marvellous and very pleasant indeed.
Great museum. Very educational. Such a peaceful and lovely location. Definitely worth a visit. Probably real good for class projects of some sort.

A part of history that must not be forgotten.  A stark contrast between the beauty if the location and the evil that was planned there. I'm glad I experienced it, but left feeling almost physically sick and tremendously sad. Not for the faint hearted!

The house of the conference, is quite impressive and luxurious. The house is surrounded by a beautiful serene garden, with small neo classical statues.  The indoors of the house are made of marble. There is a spiral staircase, leading up to the library and offices. On the front there is the dining room and other rooms to for hosting. The balcony has a view the rest of the garden and the Grosse Wannsee Lake. 
(parts of it are being renovated)
Ironically this is where the infamous Wannsee conference took place. The place where senior Nazi Officials met and devised what is regarded as the solution to the Jewish Problem. Supposedly a sterile  environment, yet the locale of one of the most terrible genocides was planned.  Not meant for the weak at heart.

If you’ve seen the film “Conspiracy” starring Kenneth Branagh, then this house is a must-see!

Aside from that, it’s off the beaten path, but easy enough to get to by train from Berlin.  There’s a bus that shuttles from the station to the house every fifteen minutes or so, I’d highly recommend taking it.

You can expect to spend about an hour here.  Easy enough to make it a stop on your way to Potsdam.

A can't miss sight, that I somehow managed to miss the first two times I visited Berlin, Tempelhof is something you won't find anywhere else. Formerly the East Berlin airport, rather than renovate or tear it down, it's been largely converted to public and park space. It hosted the marathon expo, and is the perfect space for events. The main arrival hall is still there as are baggage claims, passport control, and of course the runways. The hangars host massive event space and the grounds are perfect for exploring green spaces and maybe even taking a picnic.

Amazing historical venue, impressive building. The park itself is a really beautiful place to come and relax, walk or run. Dog friendly, also! If you want to visit the Hangar, beware you can do so only in organized tours (German or English) which would be better to buy or research online in advance.

We did a tour through the airport. The guide (Celine?) was great. The building is so impressive. We saw some special places in the building, like bunkers and a basketbal court. I would really recommend this place to anyone who visits Berlin!

We visited Berlin Tempelhof airport for the history/architecture tour and it really is worth it. It has witnessed so much in the past, good and bad and the tour was a great way to discover this.
Other than that the area is a recreational space and attracts locals for walks, cycling, and more. Quite impressive that Berlin managed to keep such a large open space available for public use.

We took the airport walking tours. It costs around 15 euros and is worth every penny! The guide took us through the terminal building and onto the tarmac. The terminal building contains hidden spaces which you would not expect in present day airports. I didn’t want the tour to end. In my opinion this was the hidden gem of Berlin.
Top location with a great view and nice beer garden... 100% nature in the city.
The Tower is closed over the winter period but still the centre for some good walks
Interesting place. In 2011 was abandoned and empty.

Surprisingly Berlin has many observation points, including this one, located at the summit of a small hill by the lake Müggelsee, south-east of Berlin city center.

The tower is part of a complex that includes a delicious restaurant.

In order to access the tower there´s a fee of 4€, which you can pay at the restaurant´s cash desk. Once you made it to the last floor of the construction, your eyes will be rewarded with a great (and very green) view of Berlin and its surrounding lakes and forests.

A must for those who love photography and great panoramas!
Great view from above

A great place to visit with a fantastic range of interesting artifacts, pretty much something for everyone with clothing, furniture, porcelain and religious artifacts.
There are some really interesting exhibitions from time to time, especially the jewellery exhibition that is not usually my thing but I really enjoyed it.
The staff are all friendly and the exhibits are displayed really well in a way that let's you really see them up close.

It's not the first time I visit this little gem - the museum has a very well curated beautifully presented permanent exhibition of several epochs, divided by period and style, over 4 floors. Sounds big, but it's totally doable within 2 hours even.
The highlight is their vast fashion collection and quality furniture collection.
Eventhough I know the permanent exhibition well, I visited lately the focus exhibition on jewelry. They integrated this special exhibition, as other 3 focus changing exhibitions, into the permanent one, so you don't pay any extra.
Entrance at 8€ is well invested.

This review is very subjective. I went here on a cold wednesday morning and was the only one there except for the security guards. It's huge with its four huge floors and have many different artifacts from many different era's. It did however feel very stuffy and was lacking a story. Not interactive and unless you are a person who can appreciate the workmanship of a vase, you won't enjoy it very much. Not my cup of tea.

A well curated museum in an interesting building.  If you have an interest in the decorative arts or fashion history, well worth a visit.  If it is not your area of interest, I would suggest another museum in the area.
The modern design section is very good but fairly small.  The rest we did not find that interesting

A must!!!!. In the barracks of a former forced labor camp three very exhaustive exibitions are showing the history of the 13 million people deported  from all over Europe and forced to work for Nazi Germany during WW2. With a  very good offer of guided tours and workshops for children and adults the documentation center is not only a museal place but also a very advanced laboratory of knowledge and education
Small museum off the beaten track

Pozostałości obozu pracy powiązana z ciekawą i autentyczną historycznie wystawą (co w Niemczech rzadko się zdarza - z powodu częstego pomijania niektórych tematów). Wizyta w tym miejscu była dla mnie niezapomnianym i bardzo poruszającym wspomnieniem. Z racji tego, że moi przodkowie byli także pracownikami przymusowymi w niemieckich obozach, skłoniło mnie to do poszukiwań ich historii. Miejsce to, choć mało popularne, z czystym sumieniem polecam.
NS Dkometer zion sollte Mann nicht vergesen auch den Krik nicht

Interessanter Ort zum Gedenken an die jüngste  deutsche Geschichte.
Sehr informativ gestaltet

Come here for a nice walk around "Schlachtensee" and have a nice cuppa. They cater nice food, but they are no gourmet joint. They are famous for their brunch on weekends, where I suspect complete families come and feast for the whole weekend. What can you say? A lifesaver on a cold and rainy day!

The location is nice, but the service is terrible. I'm talking specifically about the winery bit, on the right side (didn't try the other one). The staff is completely indifferent, it's like they're doing you a huge favour for serving you. Do they even understand the concept of their business?? I'm not usually bothered with writing reviews, particularly bad ones but, really, I can't comprehend this attitude. They just ignore you (in the hopes that you give up on your order and go away?),  push you from one waiter to the other, make you wait an eternity for a simple order and seem like they're really going out of their way to DO THEIR JOB. Completely unwilling to provide good service (or any service, it seems). A real disappointment, puts a damper on your day.

Beautiful place with a very nice outdoor. I only went there 2 times for Oktoberfest with my work but every time I ended up completely smashed. I guess free alcohol can do that to you. Anyway, this place gets 5 stars for motivating me to stop drinking ;)

Expensive famos Restaurant, Always crowded on Sunny das.
Stand Up Board Location Stars in April.
For decades I come here on each visit of Berlin. Amazing location for its location, but also food absolutely fine. Space for single, couples, and big families. Easy to reach by public transport
I love this place. Very good service.
A great place for the neighborhood, nice ambience, very friendly service. Excellent food.
Super cool place with a very kind waiter.  I imagine the place is even better in the summer, as we went mid-winter and looked longingly at the outdoor seating.

Not very good service. Wasn't told that we needed to book a table, nor was there any reserved signs on the table, yet we were told after we started eating that we sat in the wrong place. Food wasn't great, large selection but nothing exciting.
Nice and cosy place, good drinks. The food is tasty and good quality, but the portion size - price ratio is not optimal. Had brunch there which was good, so I'll up the stars from three to four.

While this is a great place, I wouldn't recommend going on a weekend. Apart from the fact that it was very crowded, we ordered 2 schnitzels and it took them less than 2 minutes to bring our food. We felt that the taste was very different to previous times. The schnitzel was refried/heated and burnt at the bottom and the salad did not look fresh. Moreover, there was a stake smell of cigarettes and ashes on the floor and seating area which is really unappealing if you're not a smoker sitting indoors.
Beautiful romantic place with great live music.

Outdoor and indoor seating and you can tour a working windmill that grinds wheat, rye and something else too.  They also sell the ground flours and baked breads.  The food was good and plentiful.  Staff was friendly and courteous!  I would go again.
I came across this restaurant, while cycling outside Berlin, and was pleasantly surprised! I tried flammekueche with mozzarella and it was delicious! Besides you can visit an old wind mill.

Amazingly catered buffet for private event. Delicious and freshly prepared food - salads, fish, veal and later deserts to die for! Super nice staff, the designated waiter for our group was a bit clumsy but made up with charm and smiles while keeping up with the service for 20+ people.  Bravo!! 

The outdoor Biergarten is superb and I will definitely come again to the rock live music and dancing and of course, the food. The old, historic mill is just next door and it transports you into another time period. Very charming! As the restaurant is close to Britzer Garten, the nearby tulip paradise and recreational heaven, combing the two is tops:  stroll after a meal or take a mighty bite after a long walk through the gardens.
Really good sushi. Probably the best sushi I ever had outside Japan. Really traditional not only in the taste but also in the location. Remember to book!

Their sushi, atmosphere, service and especially their sashimi are ten out of ten heavenly perfect, only the karaage could have been a tiny bit better because of slightly soft skin and tiny pieces of tendons inside the meat
Used to go to this restaurant back in 2006. Still as good as it was. Feels and tastes like a restaurant in Japan.
Great food and service. Super small with cozy atmosphere.
Super nice, fair price. Really traditional not posh

Excellent food and very reasonable prices. The only downside is that you need to wait a long time to get a seat and it is very loud. During warmer times you can also sit outside which relaxes the seating a bit. Recommended if you are looking for quick, good food and don't mind about the atmosphere.

I've heard of too many friends getting FOOD POISONING from this place. It's only about 60 cents cheaper than the lunch deal most vietnamese places offer in the area so I don't get the hype about the low price.
Good food. Good prices. Unfortunately I didn't find the flavors to be similar enough to Vietnam

I will give 5 stars for the speed and quality of the food so far! I have been eating here or sometimes ordering take away for a while and I must say it is always on point!
service is quick.
The only downside is that some customers don´t realise this is a eat and go kind of restaurant, and they stay there for long periods talking when there are plenty people out waiting !

i'm usually a regular as this venue was recommended to me as i like staying in Hernannplatz, except today when i arrived at 10.10pm after a long day at work they rudely first served another guest that arrived after me,  then i gave them my order and i told them i was happy to sit outside where there was adequate seating available,  but then they refused me and took an order from yet another customer.  they never smile anyway so i don't think they're worthy of tips.  i won't bother walking here to order a meal again...

Even we waited for more than half hour to have our dinner but the outcome is worthy. The lamb spine hotpot is amazing, first try in my life as it’s China cuisine but I like the taste. Would love to visit Grand Tang again.
Probably most authentic Chinese food I had in Berlin. Owner tricked me by saying something isn't spicy and proceeded to laugh at me while I suffered. 10/10 would do again.

Is it amazing Chinese food? No. Is it at least better than most places in Berlin? Sure. Will I visit again? Never. I cannot, in good conscience, continue to support and patronise an establishment that thinks it's the Berghain of restaurants. Refusing service to potential guests, rude owner and super slow service,  all left a bad taste in my mouth. My first, and last, time ever. NO thank you

The host of the restaurant asked me and my girlfriend whether somebody recommended us the place, we said "no" after what he didn't allow us to enter in telling "WE choose our guests but not they choose us". The experience was really disgusting. We couldn't expect such a boorish behaviour, especially in tolerant and multicultural Berlin which is proud of friendly and welcoming people.

Went on a Friday evening, the restaurant looked full, but I still asked to see of they had a table. I was told they're fully booked, which is fine but the owner's demeanor was rude (there was also no "if you can wait 20 min.." etc). Came back the next day for lunch, when it was very empty. Service wasn't the best but the food was alright. However, then we witnessed a presumably racist situation: a German customer (white with beard) came in alone to eat. The waitresses asked him for a reservation (there were only 4 customers in the entire restaurant). He said he didn't have one, to which the waitresses said he "usually" would need one. One of them then went to the back to ask the owner if it would be "ok". I overheard her saying "I'll ask because I don't want to get in trouble" in Chinese. They ultimately served the customer but the only explanation for their behaviour, that I can think of, is blatant racism on the owner's part. Other comments here seem to confirm that. If indeed correct, I equally blame the waitresses for following racist instructions.
Amazing Croatian cuisine. Actually better than what I had in Croatia )

It was good!  I had no idea that I liked Croatian food, having never had it before, and it was awesome.  Epic quantities of meat, a good salad, and this cool onion-pepper-paprika condiment That should happen all over the world.  Friendly helpful waiters.

Amazing ppace with amazing food. I had meat plate Split. Picture shows just half of the meats from the plate. All if it was amazing and very well prepared. For desert we had crepes with walnuts. They were amazing too. Also, all waiters speak Croatian really cool place!
Nice affordable eatery with flexible menu
Very nice restaurant with good group outing options
